The apparatus clamps to the ironing board and features a flexible cord support to keep the cord out of the way while ironing. It also includes a detachable article holder for items like spray starch or beverages. The cord support can be raised or retracted for storage, and the article holder can be easily removed. An electrical outlet can be mounted on the apparatus for convenient access. The clamp securely attaches to the ironing board, and the article holder provides a stable base for various items. The invention aims to improve convenience and organization while ironing. The design allows for compact storage when not in use. 
</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that ensures consistent buttonhole stitching regardless of fabric type. The device features a foot pad and a traveling assembly with a button-positioning mechanism. A slidable member on the assembly, positioned by the button, carries a tab that interacts with a tripping lever on the sewing machine. This interaction determines the buttonhole length based on the button size. An adjustable stop on the assembly further refines the buttonhole closure point by engaging the tripping lever. This prevents open or overlapping stitches. The operator can fine-tune the adjustable stop using a sample fabric to achieve a perfectly closed buttonhole. Once calibrated, the device ensures consistent buttonhole quality across different fabric types by compensating for variations in material slippage during sewing. </summary>

<summary>This invention improves upon existing textile treatment apparatuses by introducing a dwell stretch mechanism that increases the contact time between the fabric and the treatment liquid. The apparatus utilizes a conveyor belt to transport the fabric, a liquid applicator to apply the treatment solution, and a suction device to remove the liquid. The dwell stretch, positioned between the applicator and suction device, guides the fabric in a spread-out, single layer through a series of loops, allowing for extended liquid exposure. This design enhances the washing effect, particularly for removing soilage, without subjecting the fabric to excessive tension or the risk of smudging printed designs. The dwell stretch can be implemented using an air pass, where the fabric is suspended in loops by rollers, or a sieve drum, around which the fabric is guided in a meander pattern. Both embodiments ensure gentle handling of the fabric while maximizing the effectiveness of the treatment process. </summary>

<summary>This patent describes a dry cleaning machine with an improved air flow system designed to minimize solvent loss. The machine features separate solvent and air flow systems, with valves that isolate the solvent from circulating air during most of the cleaning cycle. During the spin cycle, airflow through the tub is prevented to reduce "streaks and swales" caused by uneven drying. A separate exhaust system draws ambient air through the access opening when the door is open, minimizing solvent vapor exposure to the user. A refrigeration system condenses solvent vapor and cools the solvent storage tank. The machine also includes a "cartridge dry" mode for drying filter cartridges before disposal.  A timer controls the various stages of the cleaning cycle, and a door switch activates the exhaust system when the door is open. Overall, the invention aims to improve the efficiency and safety of dry cleaning by reducing solvent loss and user exposure to vapors. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly for creating nonwoven webs. The system uses a quench chamber with a slot opening that spans the machine width, creating a linear plane of filaments with uniform distribution.  The filaments are drawn through the slot by high-velocity quench air, resulting in efficient energy transfer and improved web formation control. This method offers advantages over conventional systems, including higher spinning speeds, better web uniformity, easier cleaning, and lower energy consumption. </summary>

<summary>This document describes a sewing machine that uses ultrasonic waves to determine the sewing position on a work cloth. A user specifies the desired sewing position with an ultrasonic pen, which transmits an ultrasonic wave upon contact. The sewing machine, equipped with multiple receivers, detects this wave and calculates the pen's position based on the wave's propagation time. This calculation considers the known positions of the receivers and the speed of sound. The system can also utilize an embroidery unit, which moves the fabric to align the specified position with the sewing needle. Different embodiments explore variations in receiver placement, communication methods between the pen and the machine, and calculation methods for improved accuracy. Overall, this technology allows for precise and user-friendly sewing position specification. </summary>

<summary>This invention improves the functional durability of cellulosic fabrics like cotton by using ultrafine wool powder as a carrier for functional additives. These additives, including zinc oxide, titanium dioxide, and bamboo powder, provide benefits like UV protection, antibacterial properties, and moisture management. The ultrafine wool powder, derived from wool fibers too short for yarn, effectively carries and retains these additives due to its unique structure with helical macrofibrils and an absorbent matrix. The preparation is applied to fabrics through printing, padding, or foam application, followed by drying and curing. Tests demonstrate that treated fabrics exhibit significantly improved UV protection, wicking ability, wrinkle recovery, and antibacterial properties compared to untreated fabrics. The ultrafine wool powder acts like tiny springs, enhancing wrinkle resistance, while the additives provide their respective functionalities. This invention offers a sustainable and effective way to enhance the performance and longevity of cellulosic fabrics. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an automatic quilting machine that uses two separate computer systems to control the sewing process. One computer controls the movement of the quilting table in the X and Y directions, while the other controls the sewing machine head's functions, such as stitching and auxiliary tasks. This separation simplifies reprogramming and allows for greater flexibility in creating and modifying quilting patterns. Additionally, the machine can utilize a computer-aided design (CAD) system to create, store, and replicate intricate quilting designs. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a method for creating a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a pronounced 3D image using hydroentanglement. The fabric is made by layering a first fibrous matrix, a fluid-pervious support layer, and a second fibrous matrix. This layered structure is then subjected to hydroentanglement on a 3D image transfer device, which embeds the image into the fabric. The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer, preventing the fibers from the two sides from mixing while ensuring the layers remain bonded. This process results in a durable, two-sided fabric with distinct surface properties and a resilient 3D image. The fabric can be further treated with binders, surfactants, or electrostatic compounds to enhance its properties and suitability for various applications. Potential uses include hygiene products, medical gauze, wipes, protective wear, and apparel. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine to sew it onto a cut of fabric, particularly useful for stiff materials like cardboard and leather.  The device utilizes a stop mechanism that interacts with the strip material to control the sewing machine's operations, ensuring precise positioning and a continuous sewing process. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a method for seamlessly connecting two pieces of knit fabric using a flatbed knitting machine, eliminating the need for post-knitting sewing. This method involves strategically transferring loops between needles on the machine's movable needle beds to create a smooth, integrated join between the fabric pieces. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a flexible traction element, a production line for its creation, and the method of manufacturing it. The traction element consists of stranded cables with a thermoplastic-coated core strand, encased in a thermoplastic jacket. The production line features a unique extruder with a thread guide and adjustable matrix for precise cable positioning within the jacket. This design allows for the creation of flat traction elements with consistent cable spacing and a smooth jacket surface. The manufacturing method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables before sheathing them with liquefied thermoplastic in the extruder. This ensures optimal adhesion between the cables and the jacket, resulting in a strong and flexible traction element. The invention is particularly suitable for applications requiring high tensile strength and flexibility, such as lift bands and cables. 
</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a new rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that improves upon prior art by minimizing thread movement impediments. The design features a shoulder on the bobbin housing, two cams, and a spring rod that interact to control bobbin housing rotation and facilitate smooth needle thread loop movement. A capsule release device can be incorporated to further reduce thread tension by briefly rotating the bobbin housing counter to the hook rotation, creating a wider thread passage. This arrangement results in a sewing machine with smoother operation, lower thread tension, and improved stitch formation. </summary>

<summary> This invention details the creation of silicon-based micro and nanofibers using a novel electrospinning technique. The process involves creating a viscous "ink" composed of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, a solvent, and optionally a solid phase. This ink is then electrospun, forming continuous fibers that are deposited onto a substrate.  These fibers are then transformed into silicon-based materials through thermal or laser processing.  The resulting silicon-based nanofibers can be used in various applications, including material composites, electronic devices, and battery electrodes. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a spool creel with improved thread tension control. Each spool holder has a tensioning lever with a roller that interacts with the thread and a biasing arrangement controlled by fluid pressure. This allows for individual spool tension adjustment and global tension changes across the entire creel. The system also incorporates a brake shoe for rapid braking when the machine is stopped. The braking mechanism can utilize either a friction brake with a braking band or an electromagnetic brake with a magnetic system interacting with a conductive disc.</summary>

<summary> This invention describes a new sewing machine detector that uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs and stationary reflecting portions to detect needle position, speed, and thread trimmer timing. This design is more durable, cheaper to manufacture, and less prone to errors than previous detectors while also simplifying the power indication system. </summary>

<summary>This invention details a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves completing coagulation of partially coagulated yarn, followed by a specific washing procedure using water with controlled pH and minimal metal ion content, resulting in a yarn with a high degree of whiteness without the need for additional bleaching treatments. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a small, efficient deaeration tank designed to remove oxygen from pulp after an oxygen bleaching process. The tank features an inlet pipe for pulp, an outlet for deaerated pulp, and a tangential inlet for filtrate, which creates a swirling motion to release entrained oxygen.  The filtrate inlet is strategically positioned to optimize swirling and oxygen removal.  The tank's dimensions are designed to effectively deaerate pulp at a consistency of 1-5%, with an optimum consistency of around 3%. The design allows for the deaeration tank to be positioned atop the oxygen reactor, minimizing space requirements and eliminating the need for additional motors. The system offers a cost-effective solution to the challenges of pulp deaeration in oxygen bleaching processes. </summary>

<summary> This invention introduces biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials, designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process. This process optimizes material distribution for specific functions, such as maximizing out-plane stiffness. BTR composites consist of concentrated fiber tendons acting as "muscles," rigid stuffers as "bones," and a matrix material as "flesh." This arrangement, inspired by biological structures, allows for efficient load transfer and improved strength-to-weight ratios. BTR composites can be fabricated in various shapes and configurations, including flat panels, cylinders, and spheres. The use of embedded fiber tendons provides redundancy and enhances structural integrity.  BTR composites have potential applications in various fields, including aerospace, automotive, and defense, due to their lightweight and high-performance characteristics. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a load-limiting device for use in building frames to mitigate damage from dynamic events like earthquakes. The device is designed to plastically deform under high loads, absorbing energy that would otherwise cause damage to the building frame.  After a dynamic event, the deformed device can be easily replaced with a new one. This system offers a more cost-effective and less disruptive alternative to traditional bracing methods or hydraulic dampers.</summary>

<summary>
This invention details a unit-type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities, improving upon previous designs. The cabinet features a dual-construction with an outer casing and an inner casing, enhancing strength and providing space for storage and electrical devices. The outer casing is formed by upper and lower housings, each molded with integral sides, a back, and a front portion with a notch for the exit. The inner casing consists of six panels: front, back, two sides, ceiling, and bottom, assembled within the outer casing. This design allows for a flat exterior, enabling stacking and side-by-side installation. The space between the casings accommodates shelves, electrical boxes, and wiring, maximizing living space. Ventilation is achieved through strategically placed vents and a clearance between the casings. The second embodiment introduces spacer members with vent grooves within the clearance, further enhancing ventilation and soundproofing. These spacers vary in strength depending on their position and load requirements. This design prioritizes efficient space utilization, structural integrity, and user comfort. 
</summary>

<summary>
This invention introduces a portable guard rail support system designed to enhance safety at construction sites. The system addresses the shortcomings of traditional wooden guard rails, which are time-consuming to assemble, prone to damage, and often improperly reinstalled after removal. The invention comprises a metal support structure with brackets for securing wooden rails or mesh fencing, along with a base plate that can be anchored to the floor or fitted into a concrete-filled steel base for stability. The system also incorporates a safety tie-off ring for worker protection and allows for easy installation and disassembly by a single worker. This innovative design aims to improve construction site safety, reduce liability risks, and offer a durable and cost-effective alternative to conventional guard rail systems. 
</summary>

<summary>This invention details a pulsed power device and method for enhanced oil recovery (EOR). It utilizes both electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) pulses to stimulate oil flow from reservoirs. The invention addresses limitations of prior art by generating high-frequency acoustic vibrations through EM coupling, extending the effective stimulation range. It allows for multi-level and multi-well deployments, customizable pulse characteristics, and directional control for optimized stimulation. The invention also includes improvements to electrode design for increased durability. Additionally, it incorporates methods for separating recovered fluids into components like oil, gas, water, and other valuable materials. This comprehensive approach aims to significantly enhance oil recovery and processing efficiency. </summary>

<summary> This document describes a splice for connecting a soil reinforcing element to a grid-strip, effectively extending the length of the soil reinforcing element for use in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice utilizes two wave plates with interlocking protrusions that secure the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, while a connective device clamps down on the longitudinal wires, preventing their removal and creating a secure connection. </summary>

<summary>This patent describes a novel plow blade design with a fluid passage system for injecting fluid into the soil during plowing, reducing friction and required power. The blade consists of a main blade section, leading edge sections, a fluid tube, and optionally a chute for utility line installation. Fluid is delivered through the tube to voids in the leading edge sections and ejected through gaps or manifolds between the sections and the blade. The design allows for customization by varying the length of the fluid tube, the number and location of leading edge sections, and the use of different nozzles or plugs in the manifold. This enables tailoring the fluid injection characteristics to specific soil conditions and plowing depths. The invention utilizes simple manufacturing processes, making it cost-effective to produce and maintain. </summary>

<summary>This invention relates to a building system, specifically an improved stucco type cavity wall construction technique that allows for larger panels without movement joints. The system utilizes a combination of metal and non-metal mesh reinforcements embedded within a multi-layered plaster matrix applied over a batten system.  Detailed descriptions of components, materials, and assembly procedures are provided, along with illustrations and references to relevant building codes and standards. The system aims to provide a structurally sound, durable, and moisture-resistant wall solution while offering flexibility in design and compliance with building regulations. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a new safe design with a unique door locking mechanism that enhances security and reduces manufacturing costs. The safe features a steel door that slides into place and is secured with a lock bolt, while safety bolts prevent forced entry by concentrating shear forces on the lock bolt and away from the locking mechanism. </summary>

<summary>
This document describes a new method for accurately measuring fluid pressure in geological formations at specific depths. The invention involves installing a pressure sensor arrangement in a borehole, which is then filled with a cement grout.  A key feature is the creation of a void or fluid pathway in the grout around the sensor, allowing communication with the formation at the desired depth while isolating it from pressures at other depths. This is achieved by injecting fluid through the sensor arrangement to displace the grout before it fully sets. The invention also describes a method for hydrofracturing the formation to ensure a direct connection between the sensor and the formation fluid. 
</summary>

<summary> This invention proposes a jointing structure for vehicle traveling paths, particularly useful for new transit systems and bridges, that enhances safety and riding quality. The structure features a joint block bridging the expansion gap between traveling path ends, preventing tire fall-in and stuck-in situations.  Elastic members, preferably laminated rubber, are mounted within steps at the path ends, accommodating bridge girder expansion and contraction. Supporting blocks can be added to protect the path ends from damage. The invention also includes a method for mounting the elastic members, ensuring they are deformation-free at ordinary temperatures. This method involves joining the elastic members, fixing one side to its step, deforming the member towards the bridge girder axis, and then fixing the other side. This approach simplifies installation and eliminates the need for seasonal adjustments. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks in and out of a fluid treatment chamber, primarily for chilling meat products. Traditional methods like air chilling and overhead rail systems have drawbacks such as product dehydration, contamination, and limited mobility. The enclosed floor track system addresses these issues by preventing the hand truck wheels from contaminating the chilling brine solution. Two embodiments are presented: one with a hinged cover plate for horizontally axled wheels and another with inflatable seals for trucks with depending struts. Both designs ensure the brine solution remains sanitary and reusable, reducing waste and cost. The system's sloped design facilitates drainage, further enhancing hygiene. While illustrated for meat processing, the invention's principles are applicable in other industries requiring sanitary fluid treatment and wheeled transport. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a lock device for securing the boom of a work machine, such as a backhoe, to prevent unintended movement caused by vibrations or hydraulic failure. The device utilizes an engaging member (lock plate) on either the boom or boom bracket and an engaged member (lock pin) on the opposing component, allowing for manual locking and release while preventing damage during operation.</summary>

<summary> This invention describes a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable head that allows for precise suction regulation. The apparatus features adjustable roller assemblies connected to a platform, allowing the user to modify the distance between the vacuum head and the pool bottom. This adjustability eliminates the need for adjustments at the suction source, making it more efficient than prior art. Additionally, the invention includes a retrofit kit for existing pool cleaning devices, enabling them to incorporate this adjustable feature. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling systems. The apparatus features a retriever section that can slide and rotate independently on a sub-unit attached to the drill pipe, allowing it to engage and remove the wear bushing without being damaged by the drill string's weight.  The retriever section can be adapted with protruding members or a threaded end to engage different types of wear bushings. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an improved downhole vibratory tool for dislodging stuck objects ("fish"). Unlike previous designs, this tool features a central passage that allows wireline or other tools to pass through, eliminating the need for tool removal during operations. A drop-in plug activates the tool's vibratory mode by sealing the central passage and pressurizing a system of stacked pistons. These pistons deliver powerful downward forces to the stuck object, significantly exceeding the power of prior art tools. The tool incorporates an annular dump valve that cycles smoothly without impacting a seat, reducing wear and enhancing reliability. This design allows for a longer piston stroke, maximizing energy transfer to the fish. Additionally, the tool can be operated with or without impacts, depending on the desired effect. The modular design allows for customization based on wellbore conditions and equipment limitations. Overall, this invention provides a more efficient, reliable, and powerful solution for downhole vibration applications.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a precast concrete retaining wall system that is more efficient and cost-effective than traditional methods. The system consists of two main precast concrete components: a face panel with an integral counterfort and a base. The counterfort provides stability and reduces the need for extensive excavation, allowing for taller wall construction. The components are connected using a system of rebar and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring. The system also offers flexibility in design, allowing for variations in size, shape, and the inclusion of features like drainage openings and vehicle impact barriers.  The use of precast components allows for faster installation and reduces on-site labor costs. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an improved downhole heating system for oil and gas wells to increase flow rates in wells impeded by high oil viscosity or paraffin blockages. The system features a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods and a design that focuses heat in the production zone, preventing heat loss to uphole components.  A key innovation is the protection of electrical connections within the heating unit using a cement block and steel encasement, preventing failures caused by downhole fluid infiltration. This system effectively heats the production formation, allowing viscous materials to flow into the wellbore and improving overall well production. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a downhole tool for retrieving objects, particularly stuck or lost ones ("fish"), from wellbores. The tool can be an external overshot or an internal spear, both featuring telescoping inner and outer bodies. A catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions secures the bodies.  A key feature is the ability to lock and unlock the tool from the fish by simply raising and lowering the toolstring, eliminating jarring or forceful disconnections. This is achieved through a system of guide pins, recesses, and springs that control the engagement of gripping elements (collets or slips) with the fish. The tool can be configured to engage various surfaces on the fish, accommodating potential damage or wear.  The invention offers a reliable and efficient solution for downhole fishing operations, minimizing the risk of equipment damage and reducing downtime. </summary>

<summary>This document describes an improved design for engineered wood flooring, specifically addressing limitations of conventional methods. Conventional engineered floors, with a thin top layer of hardwood, are prone to detachment, deformation, and limited lifespan. The invention proposes a solution using a thicker sight substrate (at least 4mm) and a thicker base substrate (at least 12mm) for enhanced durability and maintenance. A key innovation is the use of "multidirectional holding means," including dendrites, glue, and clamps, to securely bond the layers and prevent separation. This method ensures uniform adhesion, dimensional stability, and resistance to deformation. The thicker sight substrate allows for multiple sanding and refinishing cycles, extending the floor's lifespan. Additionally, the invention suggests pre-finishing the flooring with durable coatings like aluminum oxide for enhanced scratch and wear resistance. Overall, the invention provides a more robust and longer-lasting engineered wood flooring solution.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes an attachment for a ladder that improves stability and prevents damage to the work surface. The attachment features a brace with a resilient pad that increases the contact area with the surface, preventing slipping and marring. Additionally, the design allows the ladder to straddle corners while maintaining stability.</summary>

<summary>This patent describes a new collated fastener assembly, specifically a nail strip, designed to reduce debris and improve performance. The invention utilizes a plastic collation system that adheres to the nail shanks using a modified polypropylene resin, preheating the nails before molding for enhanced adhesion. This adhesion minimizes debris generation during driving, as the plastic stays attached to the nail and penetrates the substrate. The design also incorporates features like a tapered collar, strategically placed ribs, and weakened regions to further reduce debris and improve nail penetration. The collation system can be adapted for both straight and coiled configurations.  Testing demonstrates that this design significantly reduces debris compared to traditional plastic collations and even increases nail holding power due to the adhesive properties of the plastic. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly useful in industries like aviation and automotive. The nozzle features a bell-shaped tip designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts for complete sealant coverage. An injection button with a unique design, featuring channels and orifices, attaches to the bell-shaped section. This button allows for precise sealant application, directing the flow either into rivet head chambers or along the walls of screw orifices. The nozzle can be used manually with sealant cartridges or with automated injection machines.  The design ensures a perfect seal against air and liquids, crucial for maintaining pressure and longevity in aircraft, ships, and vehicles.  The nozzle simplifies the sealing process, reducing application time and labor costs while improving the quality of the seal.  After the sealing operation, the bell-shaped tip can be cut off, transforming the nozzle into a traditional truncated-cone shape for applying sealant cords or fillers. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a position sensor that uses a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit to eliminate static and error signals, thus reducing energy consumption and allowing for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires. The sensor constantly compares its output to a desired minimum value and adjusts a correction signal to maintain the output close to the ideal minimum, with different correction speeds for slow and fast movements of the monitored object. This ensures accurate position sensing while minimizing power consumption and wiring complexity. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a new valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that is more efficient and performs better than traditional spring-loaded systems. The system uses a rotating cam and a translating mechanism to precisely control valve opening and closing, allowing for variable valve timing and lift. This results in improved fuel economy, increased engine speed capabilities, and a simpler, more robust design compared to conventional valve systems. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a light member, particularly for aquariums, with a housing containing multiple lighting control channels and removable light-emitting modules. The design allows for independent control of different light colors and intensities, customizable color temperatures, and optional features like remote control, timers, and adjustable optics. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a new method for constructing cooled flow deflection apparatuses, particularly for gas turbine blades, to improve cooling efficiency and manufacturing simplicity. Traditional blades have cast cooling channels and separating walls, leading to cooling challenges, thermal stresses, and high weight. This invention proposes using separate inserts for the separating walls, inserted and secured after the blade is cast. These inserts, made of metal or non-metal materials, offer several advantages: better cooling in critical areas, reduced thermal stresses, lower blade weight, and easier manufacturing. The inserts can be straight or U-shaped for directing cooling fluid flow and can be secured by soldering or welding. This design simplifies the blade casting process and allows for easy adjustments to the cooling system by replacing the inserts. This invention is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades due to their complex geometry and high operating temperatures. The inserts can be installed during blade production or retrofitted into existing blades with cast separating walls.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a system for controlling a vehicle's fuel delivery system, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve. The system ensures a smooth transition between modes, preventing sudden changes in vehicle speed, and offers full vehicle control in manual mode, addressing limitations of prior art. </summary>

<summary>This document describes a new waste fuel burner designed to address the inefficiencies and pollution problems of traditional hog fuel burners. The burner features a two-chamber design: a primary combustion chamber where waste fuel is gasified with preheated underfire air, and a secondary chamber where volatile gases are completely combusted with secondary air.  The burner minimizes particulate emissions by using tangential air injection and a flame holder to create swirling airflows that centrifugally separate particulate matter.  The amount of swirl air and secondary air is precisely controlled based on temperature feedback to optimize combustion efficiency and minimize slag formation.  The burner can handle fuels with high moisture content (up to 70%) and offers fast response times to changes in heat demand.  The design also extends the refractory lining's lifespan by using combustion air for cooling.  Overall, this invention provides a cleaner and more efficient method for burning waste fuels, offering a viable alternative to traditional oil and gas burners in various industrial applications. </summary>

<summary>This document describes an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream. The system utilizes return air from the cooled enclosure as the working fluid for evaporation, maximizing cooling efficiency. A specific embodiment features an array of vertically oriented tubes, with water flowing down the inside and return air flowing upwards, countercurrent to the water. Fresh air is drawn through the dry side of the heat exchanger, cooling it before being delivered to the enclosure. The system can be further enhanced by recirculating a portion of the return air to mix with fresh air or by diverting some cooled air to mix with the working return air. A hybrid system incorporates a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a portion of the cooled air stream, dehumidifying it and enhancing overall cooling efficiency.</summary>

<summary>This patent describes a fluid pump designed for high volume and high pressure applications, particularly for handling liquid manure. The pump features two or more pump heads connected in series, each containing an impeller that moves fluid through multiple conduits before combining it into a single flow. A key innovation is the drive structure, which passes through the fluid path to commonly drive all impellers while being protected from corrosion and fouling. The pump heads can be modularly connected or formed as a single unit, and the number of heads determines the operating pressure. The patent also details various support structures for the pump, including a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, and a trailer, enabling its use in different scenarios. These support structures facilitate submerging the pump into a fluid reservoir and transporting it between locations. Additionally, the pump incorporates features like an agitator nozzle to enhance fluid mixing in the reservoir and a vent pipe to regulate pressure within the system. Overall, this invention presents a robust and efficient solution for pumping fluids at high volume and pressure, addressing the limitations of existing pump designs. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes an engine compression release brake system for improved engine braking. The system utilizes a modular design, allowing for engine brakes to be installed on a portion of the engine cylinders rather than all of them. This reduces component count and enhances engine robustness. The system employs hydraulically actuated engine brakes that operate by opening the exhaust valve during the compression stroke. This releases the compressed air and provides braking power. The system's modularity allows for customization, enabling users to select the desired braking horsepower based on their specific needs. The invention details the operation of the engine brake, including the activation and deactivation of the solenoid, pilot valve, and spool valve. Overall, this innovative system offers efficient engine braking while reducing complexity and cost. </summary>

<summary>This document describes a mounting link designed to connect an aircraft engine to an auxiliary gearbox, with the ability to mitigate damage from extreme events like blade-off incidents. The link features a male and female component held together by a shearable pin, allowing for relative movement under extreme loads.  This movement is dampened by friction between the male and female components, absorbing energy and protecting the gearbox from destructive forces.  After a shear event, the pin can be replaced during maintenance, restoring the link's functionality. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an improved system for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts, particularly those made of unidirectional fibers like graphite. The system utilizes a point cap with external threads to reduce stress on the shaft, a point adaptor for broadheads, and a nock cap for securing nocks, all attached using adhesives. Additionally, a balance pin inserted into the shaft allows for precise weight adjustment of the arrow point. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a small arms fire simulator (SAFES) for training, offering a cost-effective alternative to blank ammunition.  SAFES electronically ignites pyrotechnic charges within a plastic expendable housed in a reusable unit resembling a magazine clip.  The device interfaces with the weapon's trigger and bolt for realistic semi-automatic and automatic fire simulation.  An electrical control circuit manages the firing sequence, utilizing oscillators, counters, and decoders to trigger individual pyrotechnic charges.  Upon ignition, the contained explosion ruptures a sealant, venting gases through the weapon's ejection port to mimic the sound and flash of live fire.  The system incorporates safety features, preventing firing when the bolt is open or the unit is removed.  A firing sensor signals the MILES system for integrated training exercises. The expendable contains multiple charges and is designed for inexpensive automated production. The simulator aims to provide realistic and affordable small arms training without weapon modifications.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance and reduces noise. The device includes a tank connected to the intake pipe by two pipes of different diameters. A valve in the larger pipe, controlled by engine load, optimizes volumetric efficiency by leveraging the tank's volume. The smaller pipe, acting as a resonator, minimizes intake noise.  The valve operation is strategically controlled based on engine speed and load.  At low loads, the valve remains closed. At higher loads, the valve opens and closes based on engine speed to maximize volumetric efficiency. This control strategy ensures optimal engine performance across varying operating conditions. The smaller pipe's placement near the air cleaner further enhances noise reduction without significantly impacting dynamic effects. Overall, this invention presents a balanced approach to improving both engine performance and noise reduction in internal combustion engines. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a two-part mounting bracket assembly for securing objects like speakers to poles or walls. The assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket. The stationary bracket is fixed to the mounting surface, while the adjustable bracket attaches to the object.  The adjustable bracket connects to the stationary bracket through a series of hooks, tabs, and screws, allowing for secure positioning and angle adjustment. A unique feature is the ability to temporarily secure the adjustable bracket before final tightening, making single-person installation easier. For pole mounting, specialized brackets and a chain mechanism provide a tight and adjustable grip. The design prioritizes simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and ease of installation, even for heavy objects. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a versatile burner system for heat-utilizing appliances, designed for efficiency and clean combustion. The burner features a multi-stage combustion process with primary, secondary, and tertiary air inlets to maximize fuel burning and minimize emissions.  A shroud around the combustion chamber directs airflow and provides a cool-touch exterior surface. The burner includes an ash pan for easy cleaning and a damper system for combustion control.  It also incorporates a removable grill and cover for added functionality and safety. The system's modular design allows for interchangeable heat-utilizing appliances, including cookers, a smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The pyrolyzer module enables the processing of carboniferous materials, with options for condensing and utilizing the produced gases. Overall, the invention offers a comprehensive and adaptable solution for various heat-based applications. 
</summary>

<summary>
This invention improves the cooling system of rotary internal combustion engines, particularly around the spark plugs. It addresses the problem of overheating and thermal stress caused by the in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in conventional designs. The invention introduces a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses, offset from the centerline of the coolant flow path. This staggered configuration enhances coolant flow and heat transfer, reducing vapor accumulation and hot spots.  The design ensures efficient combustion while minimizing the risk of housing distortion and structural failure due to thermal stress.  Testing has shown that this staggered arrangement significantly increases the heat transfer coefficient compared to the traditional in-line design. 
</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a method for minimizing flow disturbances in turbines during periodic operational testing of control valves. The method involves using control valve positions as feedback to maintain a constant total mass flow through parallel inlet flow control valves. This is achieved by determining the flow characteristics of the system with N valves and N-1 valves, where N is the total number of valves. During testing, when one valve is closed, the flow demand for the remaining N-1 valves is adjusted based on the flow difference characteristic between the N and N-1 conditions. This compensation minimizes changes in steam boiler pressure or turbine power, ensuring smooth operation during testing. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a mixing valve system for combining two fluids, such as water and soap solution, in varying proportions to produce a mixed output. The system utilizes a rotatable valve with offset bores to control the flow of each fluid, allowing for continuous adjustment of the mixture ratio while maintaining consistent pressure. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a method for compressing natural gas in pipelines, particularly in permafrost regions, that reduces the need for expensive and potentially dangerous re-cooling plants. The method involves compressing the gas to a pressure significantly higher than the desired pipeline pressure, cooling it using air/gas heat exchangers, and then expanding it to the final pressure. This expansion process cools the gas to the required temperature for safe pipeline transport, eliminating the need for separate refrigeration units during warmer months. The system utilizes multiple compression stages, with the option for parallel operation during colder periods when less cooling is required. This parallel operation allows for increased throughput and provides redundancy for maintenance or breakdowns. The invention also proposes using expansion turbines during the expansion process, which not only contribute to cooling but also recover energy that can be used to power the compression stages, further improving efficiency. Overall, this method offers a cost-effective and safer alternative to traditional gas compression methods in challenging environments.
</summary>

<summary>This document describes a new cooling fan assembly designed for use in computers and other electronics. The assembly features a unique mounting system that eliminates the need for traditional fasteners like screws or rivets. Instead, it utilizes a combination of resilient legs, spring members, and strategically shaped openings in the mounting panel. This design simplifies installation, reduces costs, and helps dampen vibrations for quieter operation. </summary>

<summary>
Spacecraft structures often utilize lightweight composite materials, which unfortunately lack inherent damping, making instruments susceptible to high vibration levels.  Kinematic mounts (KMs), commonly used to support instruments, also suffer from low damping, exacerbating the vibration issue.  This invention introduces novel damping features into KMs to mitigate these vibrations.  One embodiment incorporates spherical dampers at flexural hinge locations, utilizing viscoelastic material to dissipate energy as heat.  Another embodiment employs cylindrical slot dampers with viscoelastic o-rings or washers.  The invention also proposes a simplified KM design using six identical struts arranged to minimize coupling between suspension modes.  This design utilizes standard bar stock and allows for a center-of-gravity mounting system, further enhancing stability.  Modal vibration tests on these damped KMs have demonstrated significant damping improvements, effectively reducing instrument vibration levels. 
</summary>

<summary>This patent describes a new oil shear clutch unit designed for high horsepower applications, such as aircraft catapult systems. The invention features segmented clutch discs and separate piston-cylinder mechanisms for each disc segment, allowing for efficient cooling, minimal residual drag, and easy maintenance. By utilizing hydraulic fluid for both actuation and cooling, the clutch unit achieves precise torque control and reduces wear on components. </summary>

<summary> This patent describes an internal combustion engine that uses multiple expansion cylinders to capture heat energy from exhaust gases and convert it into mechanical energy. The engine injects water into the expansion cylinders to create steam, which further drives the pistons and reduces exhaust temperature. This design aims to maximize energy efficiency, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator and significantly reducing emissions. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a method for fabricating steel parts with high mechanical strength and corrosion resistance, particularly useful in the automotive industry. The process involves using steel plates pre-coated with an aluminum-based alloy, which consists of an intermetallic alloy layer and a metal alloy layer. A key innovation is the selective removal of the metal alloy layer from a specific area along the plate's periphery before welding. This prevents the formation of brittle intermetallic areas during welding and subsequent heat treatment, which would otherwise compromise the part's mechanical properties. The remaining intermetallic layer provides corrosion protection after heat treatment. The process involves laser beam welding of the prepared plates, followed by heat treatment to form a protective intermetallic compound and achieve desired mechanical properties. This method ensures both high ductility and corrosion resistance in the final part, making it suitable for safety-critical automotive components. 
</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for remotely controlling mobile structures that extract energy from severe weather patterns. The system utilizes data from GPS, weather satellites, and other sources to optimize the structure's position for energy extraction while ensuring its safety. A central service facility houses servers that process weather data and communicate with the mobile structure via wireless communication. The system includes a graphical user interface (GUI) that allows human operators to monitor and control various aspects of the mobile structure's operation, including navigation, energy extraction, and safety features. The GUI provides visual representations of the structure's position, heading, velocity, and surrounding weather conditions. It also allows operators to manually adjust control settings or rely on the system's algorithms for automated navigation and energy optimization. Overall, the invention enables the safe and efficient extraction of energy from hazardous weather environments by combining remote sensing, data analysis, and human oversight. </summary>

<summary> This invention relates to a rolling body guide cage, typically used in bearings, that is made from a sheet metal ring element. The ring element is formed by joining together, typically by welding, multiple flat material ring segments. This method reduces material waste compared to traditional methods that punch out the entire ring element from a sheet. The invention details the design of the ring segments, their joining process, and potential applications in various bearing types. </summary>

<summary>This patent describes methods and systems for improving customer service in the telecommunications industry by using GPS technology to accurately locate customer service locations. The system utilizes a technician input device, such as a laptop or PDA, which communicates with a technician server through wireless or landline connections. The technician server interacts with various systems, including a GPS system, dispatch system, address guide system, and customer record system. When a technician visits a customer service location, the system can obtain the latitude and longitude coordinates of the location using the GPS system and update the relevant databases. This information can then be used to efficiently dispatch technicians to service locations and provide them with driving directions using a mapping system. The system ensures accurate location information is associated with customer addresses, improving response times and overall customer satisfaction. By leveraging GPS technology and integrating it with existing telecommunications infrastructure, the system streamlines service operations and enhances the customer experience. The patent also describes the use of computer-readable media for storing and accessing the software components of the system. Overall, the invention provides a comprehensive solution for managing customer service locations and improving service delivery in the telecommunications industry. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields by generating a corresponding compensation field. The two sensors measure the interfering field, and their signals are combined into a virtual sensor signal representing the field at the protected object's location. The control unit, preferably a digital signal processor (DSP) or field-programmable gate array (FPGA), processes the virtual sensor signal using customizable control loops to generate control signals for the coils. The system can adapt to different interfering field structures and can be used in single or double installations. In double installations, where two systems operate side-by-side, a feedback mechanism is implemented to account for mutual interferences. This feedback mechanism uses a cross-coupling matrix to eliminate crosstalk between the two systems, ensuring effective compensation. </summary>

<summary>This patent describes a method for enhancing CARS microscopy by introducing specific resonance sites into biological samples. The method utilizes bioorthogonal reactions, which are chemical reactions that can occur within living systems without interfering with natural processes. This allows for the tagging of specific structures within the sample, including the non-resonant background, which is typically difficult to control in conventional CARS microscopy. The introduction of resonance sites can be achieved by either incorporating them into the reaction partners or generating them during the bioorthogonal reaction itself. This approach enables the visualization of structures that are not inherently detectable by CARS microscopy and improves the reproducibility of the technique. The patent also highlights specific bioorthogonal reactions, such as copper-free click chemistry and Staudinger ligation, as particularly advantageous for this application. Overall, the invention provides a powerful tool for enhancing the sensitivity, specificity, and reproducibility of CARS microscopy for investigating biological samples.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a system for comparing 3D anatomical segmentations generated from medical images, which quantifies differences in terms of volume and distance metrics.  This system can be used to evaluate and train clinicians, assess auto-segmentation algorithms, and potentially guide re-planning of radiation therapy treatments.</summary>

<summary>This patent describes a method and apparatus for accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating-point units. The invention achieves acceleration by calculating the difference between subsets of operand exponent arguments before the complete difference is available. Based on this subset difference, operations on operand fractions are initiated, leading to faster computation. The subset is chosen strategically so that if the initial operation is incorrect based on the complete exponent difference, the correct result is readily available as one of the original operand fractions. This method reduces the number of steps required for effective subtraction, thereby improving the overall speed of floating-point operations. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a system for accurately tracking patient specimens using barcodes. The system involves assigning unique barcodes to patients, orders, specimen vials, and specimen-takers.  A central computer system stores these barcodes and their relationships in a database. When a specimen is collected, the system verifies the patient's identity, order details, and specimen container information by scanning their respective barcodes. This information is then linked in the database, creating a comprehensive record of the specimen collection event. This system eliminates the need for physical labels on vials, reducing errors and costs associated with traditional labeling methods. By automating the tracking process, the invention aims to achieve a zero-defect system for identifying and processing patient specimens. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a voice-activated distance measuring device, particularly useful for golfers. The device utilizes GPS technology and voice recognition to provide audible distance and other relevant information to the user. It can be incorporated into headgear or clothing and uses bone conduction technology for clear voice input. The device can also store and analyze user performance data to provide strategic recommendations. Additionally, it can record golf course layouts using GPS coordinates for distance calculations and other purposes. The device can connect to external devices for data transfer and expanded functionality. </summary>

<summary>This patent describes a system and method for improving design rule checking (DRC) in semiconductor manufacturing, particularly for System-on-Chip (SoC) designs containing both logic and memory circuits. The invention addresses the problem of false DRC errors generated when standard logic rules are applied to memory regions, which have more relaxed design constraints. It proposes creating customized design rules for different memory types by modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the more liberal parameters of memory cells. This involves identifying memory regions within the chip layout and applying the appropriate set of rules – logic rules for logic regions and customized memory rules for memory regions. This approach eliminates false errors, improves accuracy, and speeds up the design verification process. The invention is applicable to various semiconductor manufacturing processes and can be implemented using conventional computing systems and software. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a new illumination system using waveguide holograms (WGH) that offers advantages over conventional lens-based systems, such as compactness, higher diffraction efficiency, and improved control over illumination patterns. The invention addresses challenges like illumination depletion and alignment sensitivity inherent to WGHs, proposing solutions like non-uniform hologram recording and secure source attachment.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors used in induction motors. The apparatus utilizes a test head that mimics a stator core, with windings to generate a magnetic field and sensors to measure voltage, current, and skew.  A rotor placed within the test head is rotated, inducing voltages and generating magnetic flux that is measured by the sensors.  The apparatus includes a data acquisition and processing system that samples and analyzes the sensor signals to determine the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew.  These values are compared to predetermined thresholds to identify defective rotors.  The system also provides statistical analysis of test results for quality control purposes.  The apparatus is designed for efficiency, with a dual fixture system that allows operators to prepare one rotor while another is being tested.  This invention offers a non-destructive, automated, and cost-effective solution for testing and ensuring the quality of dynamoelectric machine rotors. </summary>

<summary>This document describes a system for securely running third-party applications on a closed mobile device. To protect sensitive resources, the system utilizes a layered approach with a trusted layer and an arbitration layer. The trusted layer consists of the operating system and core functionalities, while the arbitration layer manages access to these resources for third-party applications.  Applications are packaged in containers with digital signatures for authentication and may include certificates granting access to specific managed libraries. These libraries act as intermediaries, allowing controlled access to native system resources through a runtime host.  A manager component within the arbitration layer enforces access control based on the application's certificate and prevents direct access to sensitive resources. This system ensures that third-party applications can utilize device functionalities without compromising the security of the mobile device. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an improved identification card that is durable and easy to manufacture. The card contains an antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers. These layers are then laminated between two rigid outer layers for added support and protection. The card's construction protects the electronic components from damage due to bending stresses. The manufacturing process involves printing antennae and attaching IC chips onto a pre-shrunk core layer. This core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet, and the assembly is laminated between polymer layers, with optional image-receiving layers and protective layers added for personalization and security. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a novel method for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment, which traditionally struggles with the inefficiency of copying entire data structures during updates. The invention utilizes a tree-shaped data structure with nodes of a defined maximum size, where data additions and deletions occur at leaf nodes on the tree's edges. This approach minimizes copying by only replicating the path from the root to the updated node, resulting in logarithmic time and space complexity. The invention further enhances efficiency by introducing a header node with pointers to the beginning, middle (tree structure), and end of the queue, allowing for faster updates and reduced memory usage. This header node can also include an inversion bit, enabling constant-time queue reversal and facilitating double-ended queue functionality. The invention provides a significant improvement over traditional FIFO queue implementations in functional memories, offering reduced copying, faster updates, and the flexibility of double-ended queue operations. </summary>

<summary>This document describes the invention of new EPROM (Electrically Programmable Read-Only Memory) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit technologies. One type of EPROM device utilizes the storage capacitors used in DRAM (Dynamic Random-Access Memory) as coupling capacitors for the EPROM cells, enabling the fabrication of both DRAM and EPROM on the same wafer without significant cost increase. Another type, called SEPROM (Stress Effect Programmable Read-Only Memory), leverages the permanent changes in transistor properties caused by electrical stresses like hot carrier effects and gate voltage stress to store data. SEPROM devices can be manufactured using various IC technologies and are suitable for embedded applications, particularly in security due to their undetectable nature. The document details the structure, manufacturing process, operation principles, advantages, and potential drawbacks of these novel EPROM devices. Overall, these inventions offer cost-effective solutions for integrating programmable memory into various IC designs, including DRAM redundancy circuits and secure data storage. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a method for determining optimal feedback gain values in a feedback control system, particularly for an Automatic Guided Vehicle (AGV). The method involves setting initial feedback gain values, running the AGV, and measuring its deviation from the desired course.  Evaluation functions are used to assess the performance of the proportional, integral, and derivative gains based on the measured error. The process is repeated with adjusted gain values until the evaluation functions indicate optimal performance. This method allows for the determination of optimal gain values for different sections of the AGV's course, ensuring stable, accurate, and responsive control. The invention provides a systematic and efficient approach to optimize feedback control systems for various applications. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a zoom lens with a high relative aperture and zoom ratio while maintaining a small size. The lens comprises five units, with the fourth and fifth units being critical for aberration correction. The fourth unit collimates diverging light, while the fifth unit forms the image and corrects residual aberrations. Specific conditions for lens elements within these units are crucial for achieving desired optical performance. This design allows for a compact zoom lens with good image quality, suitable for cameras. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles using a detector that generates charge pulses. The invention features low-voltage side signal tapping for improved signal-to-noise ratio and the use of both fast and slow amplifiers to enable both individual particle detection and integrated measurements over a wide range of signal rates. This allows for versatile particle detection without prior knowledge of signal rates, finding applications in fields like particle physics, medical imaging, and reactor monitoring. The detector material can be doped or coated to enhance the detection of uncharged particles.</summary>

<summary>This invention describes an apparatus and method for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus utilizes a stationary ring and a movable ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly. A torque motor applies rotational force to the assembly, while a servo motor controls the movement of the movable ring. An electronic position sensor measures the distance between the rings, providing data on the assembly's warpage. A microprocessor analyzes the sensor data and determines if the warpage is within acceptable tolerances. The apparatus provides visual feedback to the operator, indicating whether the assembly passed or failed the spin check. This automated system eliminates manual operations, improves efficiency, and enables statistical process control by recording measurements for each tested assembly. The invention aims to enhance the accuracy and speed of driven disc assembly inspection in a production environment. </summary>

<summary>This invention relates to image processing, specifically face age-estimation. The inventors found that contourlet transform and classifying faces by aging mechanisms improve age-estimation accuracy. The method involves training a system with images of faces with assigned landmark points and known ages. A Contourlet Appearance Model (CAM) algorithm extracts feature vectors from these images. These vectors are used to train an age classifier (youth/adult) and two aging functions (growth/development and adult aging). To estimate the age of a new face image, the CAM algorithm extracts its feature vector. The classifier determines if the face is youthful or adult, and the corresponding aging function estimates the age. The system can be implemented on various computing devices and provides age estimations with confidence factors. The described embodiments are illustrative, and the invention's scope is not limited to them. </summary>

<summary> This invention describes a matrix display device that can merge and display two images simultaneously, even if they have different resolutions. The device uses a mosaic of pixel arrangements, with a dedicated number of pixels in each arrangement assigned to display each image.  The invention details methods for color assignment and contrast enhancement to ensure both images are clearly visible.  The document provides several practical examples, including merging night vision images with infrared or graphical data. Overall, the invention offers a solution for efficient and high-quality merging of multiple images on a single display. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system that incorporates a removable payment element. The payment element can be removed from the transmitter housing to prevent unauthorized use while still allowing the transmitter to function for vehicle access.  The invention details various embodiments for the housing, closure mechanisms, and communication means to ensure secure and reliable operation of both the vehicle security and payment functions. </summary>

<summary>This document details methods and systems for intelligently charging toner in imaging devices like printers and copiers. The system monitors user activity and predicts periods of inactivity, during which toner charge naturally decays.  Based on the predicted inactivity and measured toner charge decay, the system proactively charges the toner to a predetermined level before the next predicted use. This ensures consistent image quality even after extended periods of inactivity, overcoming issues of inconsistent and darker images experienced in prior art. The described methods can be implemented in software, hardware, or a combination of both. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a rotary magnetic head apparatus and method for independently controlling the bias current of multiple magneto-resistive (MR) heads mounted on a rotary drum. By prioritizing the transmission of head switching and operating current data over other control data, the invention ensures precise head switching and stable data recording and reproduction.</summary>

<summary>This invention improves the process of locating and tracing buried conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, especially when multiple objects are close together. Traditional methods struggle to differentiate between adjacent objects, leading to inaccurate tracing. This invention utilizes a transmitter with two antennae that induce distinct alternating currents in the objects. These currents create unique magnetic fields that are detected by a receiver. The receiver distinguishes between the fields by analyzing their frequencies, modulations, or pulse rates, producing a distinct output signal for each object. This allows for accurate tracing of a specific object even when others are nearby. The transmitter's position relative to the objects influences the signal clarity, and optimal positioning enhances the system's effectiveness. This invention significantly improves the accuracy and ease of locating and tracing buried conductive objects in close proximity. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication. The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means for connecting the apparatus with the telephone network, and a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker device to receive incoming telephone calls.  Two embodiments of the interfacer are disclosed, one using an optocoupler and the other using a neon lamp optically coupled with a photocell, both of which ultimately trigger a relay to connect the speaker phone to the telephone line.  Both embodiments also include a timer for controlling the length of time of such interconnection and a bypass switch for bypassing the timer. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a repeaterless optical fiber communication system, particularly useful for undersea networks, that utilizes a trunk and branch ring topology for enhanced survivability. The system eliminates the need for costly undersea repeaters by employing remotely pumped optical amplifiers.  A light emitting power source, located at a hub or cable station, transmits energy at a non-signal wavelength through the branch fiber optic cable. This energy powers an optical amplifier located within the branch cable, trunk cable, or branching unit, amplifying attenuated communication signals. The system allows for flexible network configuration with tunable add/drop branching units and addresses sovereignty concerns often associated with undersea networks. By leveraging remote pumping technology through existing branch cables, the invention significantly reduces capital, operating, and maintenance costs associated with traditional repeater-based systems. This cost-effective and robust design makes it ideal for long-haul, high-capacity undersea communication networks. 
</summary>

<summary> This invention describes a new cover plate device for electrical wiring devices that eliminates exposed screws. The device consists of two parts: an attachment plate and a cover plate. The attachment plate is secured to the electrical box and the wiring device, while the cover plate snaps onto the attachment plate using a system of latching pawls and saw-tooth racks. This design allows for easy installation and removal without visible fasteners. The cover plate can also adjust to uneven walls due to the independent operation of the latching mechanisms.  The number of pawls, racks, and tabs varies depending on the size of the cover plate and the number of wiring devices it needs to accommodate. Overall, this invention provides a safer and more aesthetically pleasing solution for covering electrical wiring devices. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, improving upon existing designs. The device comprises multiple concentric annular strips that nest tightly together, surrounding the screen when deployed. These strips slide over each other, transitioning between a compact, folded state and an expanded, light-blocking state.  The strips feature hooks and locking projections for secure deployment and retraction. An adapter member with a flexible design allows attachment to various monitor shapes. The strips' decreasing thickness towards their outer edges enables angled positioning, accommodating different viewing angles. This invention provides a cost-effective, user-friendly, and adaptable light-shielding solution for screens.</summary>

<summary>This invention proposes a system to improve communication between a speaker and a listener, especially when they don't share a native language. The system monitors the speaker's speech rate and compares it to the listener's estimated comprehension rate. If the speaker's rate exceeds the listener's capacity, the system alerts the speaker to slow down. This alert can be delivered through various sensory mechanisms like vibration, sound, or visual cues on a wearable device. The system can also analyze the clarity of the speech and the quality of the communication channel to adjust the speaking rate threshold. Additionally, it can identify alternative languages spoken by both parties and suggest a switch for better understanding. This invention aims to facilitate smoother conversations by bridging language barriers and promoting effective communication. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a device for capturing rapid processes using a modified TV camera to achieve higher frame rates. Conventional TV cameras have limited frame rates, making them unsuitable for analyzing fast-changing phenomena. This device modifies the vertical deflection and beam suppression mechanisms of a standard TV camera to achieve this. A cyclic counter controls the scanning of a reduced number of lines per frame, significantly increasing the frame rate. For instance, by scanning only 8 lines per frame, the device achieves a frame rate of approximately 2000 frames per second. While this reduces vertical resolution, the horizontal resolution remains high. The device allows for adjustable time resolution by changing the number of lines scanned per frame. The captured video signals can be digitized and processed for analysis, enabling the study of rapid processes that previously required expensive high-speed cameras. The invention is also applicable to capturing images in infrared, ultraviolet, and X-ray wavelengths. </summary>

<summary>This invention improves multimedia communication by enabling legacy phones and systems to handle multimedia calls. It introduces a "blended call" concept, combining voice and multimedia functions in a single session. A key component is the "blender" software, which manages these blended calls by interacting with both telephony and multimedia servers. For incoming calls, the system checks for blended capabilities and routes the call accordingly, creating parallel voice and multimedia components. Outgoing calls follow a similar process, initiating both components based on the user's capabilities. The system leverages protocols like SIP-T for communication and control, ensuring efficient handling of signaling and bearer paths. This approach extends the lifespan of existing network equipment while offering enhanced multimedia services. </summary>

<summary>This document describes a content synchronization framework for connected devices that uses dynamic attributes and file bundles to efficiently synchronize content based on device context. The framework prioritizes downloads, handles connection disruptions, and allows for distributed processing on both the client and server sides, making it scalable and bandwidth-efficient. </summary>

<summary>This invention details a system for anonymously connecting owners of lost items with the finders of those items.  The system uses unique IDs on tags attached to possessions, a registration database to connect owners to their items, and a communication portal that allows anonymous messaging between finders and owners.</summary>

<summary>This document describes a novel electron multiplier design that utilizes a series of thin foils to amplify electron signals. This design boasts higher gain efficiency compared to traditional electron multipliers like discrete dynode and continuous dynode types. The foil electron multiplier also exhibits an inherent rejection of ion feedback, a common problem in continuous electron multipliers. </summary>

<summary>This invention describes a device called the 3-D Phenomenoscope, which enhances the viewing experience of ordinary 2D motion pictures by creating a 3D effect. The device utilizes the Pulfrich effect, where a darkened lens over one eye creates the illusion of depth for objects moving laterally on the screen. The 3-D Phenomenoscope consists of glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital sensor to capture images from the motion picture, and a computer processor. The processor runs a lens control algorithm that analyzes successive frames of the motion picture to detect lateral motion and its direction. Based on the detected motion, the algorithm sends signals to control the darkening of the left and right lenses, creating the 3D illusion. This invention eliminates the need for special filming or projection equipment and works with various motion picture formats, enhancing the viewing experience of both old and new movies. </summary>

<summary>
This invention describes a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure instead of a traditional wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines of a semiconductor wafer to facilitate a clean break.  First, a photoresist layer is applied to the wafer surface and patterned to expose the scribe lines.
