Bo manages to get Chaz to cooperate with the investigation. </summary>

<summary>This episode of Days of Our Lives centers around the impending wedding of Brady and Kristen, an event that is causing turmoil for several characters. John, still in love with Kristen, vows to stop the wedding, while Marlena grapples with her feelings and Victor's advice to move on. </summary>

<summary>
Tensions rise in Salem as Nick Fallon files for custody of Arianna, causing conflict with Will, Sonny, and Gabi.  Kate informs Lucas of the situation, and they worry about the impact on Allie.  Meanwhile, Jordan decides to stay in Salem for Rafe, despite her initial hesitation.  Abigail confides in Will about a secret involving Nick, while Julie encourages Nick to seek professional help for his inner turmoil.  Later, Nick is found shot in Horton Square, leaving everyone in shock and searching for answers.  The episode ends with the mystery of Nick's shooter remaining unsolved. 
</summary>

<summary>
Marlena's funeral is taking place, but many believe she is innocent of the charges against her. Sami is distraught over her mother's death and blames John, Kate, and Bo.  Hope is worried because she hasn't heard from Shawn.  It is revealed that Jan is holding Shawn captive in a love nest.  Nicole blackmails Jan into getting her money to bail Crystal out of jail.  During Marlena's funeral, Celeste hears Marlena's voice telling her not to let them bury her.  Sami stays behind after the funeral and hears Marlena's voice calling to her from inside the casket.  Sami opens the casket to find that Marlena is alive.
</summary>

<summary>John's warehouse burned down and he suspects Philip is behind it, leading to increased tension and threats between them.  Meanwhile, Lucas is hiding something from Sami, who is desperate to prove she can be trusted.  Elsewhere, Max reveals to Nick that he has a hidden intellectual gift but refuses to embrace it, causing a rift between them.  Philip is implicated in the arson but denies involvement, leaving Chloe and Bo suspicious. </summary>

<summary>
Chloe and Daniel are getting married at the hospital. Chloe is anxious about the wedding and wants to get it over with. Daniel assures her that he loves her and wants to marry her. Carly shows up at the hospital as Daniel and Chloe's wedding is about to begin. Alice Horton is close to death and her family is gathering to say goodbye.  Madeline tries to convince Chad to go to college out of state, but he decides to stay in Salem.  Stefano and Kate are worried that Madeline will use the information she has against them.
</summary>

<summary>Hope and Aiden are going on a romantic getaway to the Green Mountain Lodge.  Meanwhile, Ciara gets a volunteer position at Shady Hills, the same psychiatric hospital where Abigail is being treated.  The episode ends with Roman and Rafe being confronted by Monahan, who claims to have killed Stefano DiMera. </summary>

<summary>EJ asks Abe to officiate his and Sami's wedding, and Sami asks Abigail to be her maid of honor. Abigail is overwhelmed with planning the wedding but agrees to do a reading at the ceremony. Paige's mom, Eve, arrives in Salem and meets JJ. Eve is wary of JJ because he seems like a "stoner, rock and roll" type, but Paige assures her that he is a good guy. Jordan and Rafe are still not talking, and Kate encourages Jordan to be there for him. Rafe is upset because he feels responsible for Gabi's situation.  Eve learns that JJ is a Deveraux and is shocked to learn that Paige's boyfriend is JJ Deveraux. </summary>

<summary>
The episode revolves around several intertwined storylines. Victor is mourning Caroline's death and suspicious of Nicole and Xander's partnership. Hope searches for Ted, who is being held captive by Xander under Nicole's orders.  Nicole, grieving Holly's death, pushes Eric away and rejects Brady's romantic advances.  Sami confronts Nicole about her treatment of Eric and suspects she is hiding something.  Rex surprises Sarah with a proposal and asks Eric to officiate their wedding.  Meanwhile, Ted convinces Xander to spare his life by appealing to his desire to change for Sarah.  Kate offers to investigate Nicole for Victor.  The episode ends with Nicole discovering that Kate has found her secret. 
</summary>

<summary>Hope remains convinced that Ben is guilty of setting the fire at the cabin and is frustrated by the lack of progress in the investigation.  Ciara is torn between Tripp and Ben, who continues to manipulate the situation.  Abigail struggles to accept her pregnancy and grapples with the presence of Stefan, the baby's father. Chad, deeply affected by Abigail's pregnancy with Stefan's child, seeks guidance from Marlena. Lani experiences emotional turmoil as she receives a death certificate for her son, leading to a tense encounter with Eli. Gabi questions her own character after JJ expresses his belief in her goodness.  Hope, determined to see Ben brought to justice, takes matters into her own hands. </summary>

<summary>Kristen Dimera disrupts Marlena and John's wedding, holding the guests hostage and threatening Marlena's life. She reveals that she is the reason Susan Banks relapsed and that she is seeking revenge for Marlena pushing her out of a window. Meanwhile, Will, who has been experiencing memory flashes, remembers his wedding to Sonny and their life together. Kristen manipulates Sami, who is desperate to believe EJ is alive, into pointing the gun at John.  Kristen claims EJ is alive and promises to reunite them if Sami shoots John.  </summary>

<summary>JJ reveals to his mother, Jennifer, that he is working undercover for the DEA to bring down Kyle. Eve, Paige's mother, discovers JJ's secret and uses it to drive a wedge between Paige and Kyle. Meanwhile, Chad and Serena share a night of drinking and passion, leading to a tense encounter when Ben arrives. Hope and Aiden share a tender moment as they plan for Salem's bicentennial celebration. Adrienne and Lucas enjoy a thrilling bungee jumping date, but Adrienne's lingering feelings for Justin put a damper on the evening. Eve, seeking solace after her confrontation with Paige, sets her sights on Justin at the bar.</summary>

<summary>Kate is in critical condition after being shot, with suspicion falling on Vivian. Eve, seeking revenge against Jack for their bitter breakup, sabotages his memory serum research. Meanwhile, Kristen attempts to rekindle her romance with Brady, who grapples with his feelings for her and his sobriety. Sarah reveals to Eric that she has no regrets about their relationship but acknowledges they must move on. Xander surprises Nicole with divorce papers and reveals his feelings for Sarah, who is pregnant. As Nicole and Eric reunite, Brady rejects Kristen's advances, leading to a dramatic confrontation.  Will anxiously awaits news about his grandmother's surgery while Sonny comforts him.  </summary>
<summary> Orpheus, having taken Marlena hostage, injected himself with a sedative from her medical bag and died.  JJ, after being shot by Orpheus, slipped into a coma after surgery. </summary>

<summary>Eve Donovan reveals to Victor and Brady that Deimos left her controlling interest in Basic Black, making her the new CEO.  Brady is demoted by Victor due to his drinking and tasked with getting rid of Eve.  Gabi is offered a job at Countess W by Kate, who also hired Abigail as the new head of PR for Dimera.  Rafe and Eli clash at the police station, with Eli accusing Rafe of being jealous of Hope's promotion.  Brady tells Rafe and Eli that he knows who killed Deimos and points to Eve. </summary>

<summary>
Paul decides to leave Salem for an experimental program in San Francisco that could help him walk again.  Will breaks up with Paul and wants to get back together with Sonny, who left town after learning about Will and Paul's engagement. Tripp confesses to Ciara that he framed Ben for arson, and they break up. Valerie gets offered the position of Chief of Staff at her old hospital in D.C. and considers a long-distance relationship with Abe, who is hesitant about the idea. 
</summary>

<summary>Abe and Valerie go on a date, but his son Theo is suspicious of her motives. Meanwhile, Chad confides in Sonny about his feelings for Gabi, who has decided to give JJ another chance.  Elsewhere, Steve and Paul discover that Eduardo is involved in a counterfeiting scheme. Abigail considers revealing herself to Chad but ultimately decides against it. </summary>

<summary>The episode revolves around several interconnected storylines on New Year's Eve.  Carly confesses to Daniel that she killed Lawrence, but Vivian knows her secret and is determined to make her suffer.  Meanwhile, Melanie and Philip decide to elope to Las Vegas, much to Nathan's dismay, who still has feelings for Melanie.  Elsewhere, Hope and Justin search for evidence against Vivian at Victor's mansion, while Sami contemplates telling Rafe about the ransom note. </summary>

<summary>Luke is recovering from a heart attack in the hospital, but his wife Tracy doesn't trust him to follow doctor's orders. Sonny gets arrested for assault in New York, and Jason and Carly struggle to find information about his whereabouts.  Alexis and Diane are both nominated for Litigator of the Year and begin searching for the perfect dress for the event.  Nikolas is visited by the ghost of Emily, who encourages him to enjoy life in the present.  Epiphany receives a distressing phone call from her son, Stanford, who is in danger after being targeted by Jerry. </summary>
<summary>Sonny shot Dante, who was undercover as Dominic, not knowing he was his son. Dante is in critical condition and Sonny is struggling with the fact that he shot his own son. </summary>

<summary>
The text details a day in the life of the residents of Port Charles as they grapple with the fallout of a series of attacks and the disappearance of Sonny's son, Michael.  Tensions are high between the Corinthos and Zacchara families as they try to maintain a truce while searching for the missing boy. Meanwhile, Nikolas is haunted by visions of his deceased wife, Emily, which ultimately lead him to uncover the identity of her killer. 
</summary>

<summary>
Sonny's trial for Claudia's murder is approaching, and tensions are high.  Dante, Sonny's son and the undercover cop who helped build the case against him, is determined to see his father go to prison.  Michael, Sonny's other son, feels responsible for the situation and wants to protect his father.  Meanwhile, Johnny Zacchara is making moves against Sonny's organization, leading to a confrontation with Jason.  Lucky, caught in the middle, tries to keep the peace and protect his brother, Ethan, who is caught up in Johnny's schemes.  Elsewhere, Elizabeth grapples with her pregnancy, unsure of the father's identity and determined to raise her children alone.  Alexis and Diane prepare for Sonny's trial, navigating their shared office space and personal lives.  Spinelli, eager to prove himself to Maxie, stumbles upon a potential serial killer case.  As the episode ends, Dante confronts Michael, demanding to know the truth about Claudia's death. 
</summary>

<summary>Todd, consumed by grief and rage, attempts to kill Sonny, believing him responsible for the deaths of Cole and Hope.  Starr, devastated by the loss of her boyfriend and daughter, confronts Sonny, blaming him for the accident. Meanwhile, Maxie struggles to cope with Robin's death, feeling guilty about their last encounter. </summary>

<summary>
Sonny confesses to Carly that he slept with Nelle, leading to a heated argument at Morgan's grave. Meanwhile, Olivia Jerome kidnaps Alexis and forces Julian to shoot her, but it's unclear who was shot. Curtis helps Jason disarm a bomb at the hospital, saving everyone inside.  Carly and Ava team up to find Olivia, who is revealed to be alive and responsible for Morgan's death.  Sam and Jason return home from the hospital with their newborn baby, while Finn decides to check himself into rehab. Jordan investigates Olivia's whereabouts with Dante and Curtis's help. 
</summary>

<summary>
Brandon, who tried to rape Abby, is out on bail and threatening to turn the tables on Michael if Abby testifies. Abby decides to drop the charges to protect Michael, but he is determined to make Brandon pay. Meanwhile, Luke is wracked with guilt over hitting and killing Jake, especially since he had been drinking. Sonny tries to comfort Luke, pointing out that it was an accident and anyone could have hit Jake. Elizabeth blames herself for not watching Jake closely enough and for letting Lucky take the boys to the wedding. She believes that if she had been a better mother, Jake would still be alive. Dante worries that Michael will take the law into his own hands and go after Brandon, which could send him back to prison. Theo is reunited with his grandson, whom Suzanne had been hiding from him. They plan to raise the boy together and keep his existence a secret from Brenda.
</summary>

<summary>Alexis expresses concern to Jason about the dangers of raising a child given his lifestyle, particularly in light of Jake's death. Tensions rise between Carly and Jax over custody of Josslyn, fueled by Jax's distrust of Shawn, whom Carly hired to protect Josslyn from Franco. Robin is trapped in her basement by Lisa, who intends to frame Patrick for Robin's murder. Brenda struggles to bond with her son, Alec, and feels increasingly distant from Sonny due to his secrecy and their differing lifestyles. Kristina confides in Michael about her accidental addiction to hydrocodone, given to her by Lisa. Carly convinces Shawn to continue protecting Josslyn despite Jax's attempts to discredit him. Sonny confides in Jason about his doubts regarding his marriage to Brenda, fearing he cannot guarantee Alec's safety. Brenda expresses her frustrations with Sonny's secrecy and her own struggles with motherhood to Jax. Carly thanks Carly for her kindness towards Alec during the ordeal with Suzanne. Lisa bids farewell to a trapped Robin, vowing revenge against her and Patrick. </summary>

<summary>Nikolas is missing and presumed dead after an apparent struggle at Wyndemere.  Jason is the prime suspect and a warrant is issued for his arrest.  Nikolas had staged his own death to escape legal and financial troubles, framing Jason for his disappearance.  Meanwhile, Lucas is recovering at General Hospital after being attacked by an unknown assailant.  He remembers his attacker wearing a white lab coat, leading to suspicion falling on several doctors, particularly Finn, who is rumored to have a drug problem.  Hayden's mother, Naomi, arrives and reveals that Nikolas stole her diamonds.  She offers to help Hayden with her legal troubles in exchange for the diamonds.  Nathan confesses to Maxie that he shot Claudette's lover years ago, a secret he has been keeping from her.  Maxie is unsure if she can forgive Nathan for lying to her and leaves to stay with her parents.  Jason and Sam hide out at Sonny's safe house while they try to clear Jason's name. </summary>

<summary>This dramatic episode centers around the complicated relationships within the Corinthos family and their associates.  Tensions rise as Nikolas breaks up with Rebecca, Olivia gets involved with Johnny, and Claudia plots against Jason with potentially deadly consequences. </summary>

<summary>Maxie is dying as B.J.'s heart is failing and Georgie wakes up from her surgery.  Reese reveals to Ric that she knows Carly from high school and is jealous of the life she has built. </summary>

<summary>
Patrick and Robin argue about Robin's potential pregnancy and Patrick's ability to be a father. Carly suspects she might be pregnant but is unsure if the father is Jax or Sonny. Sonny proposes to Kate, who insists on a prenup due to Sonny's past. Jason falls ill, and a delirious Spinelli predicts that Sonny will force Jason to kill him. Lulu confronts Maxie about her pursuit of Johnny and her insensitive comments about Laura. Logan attacks Johnny for his involvement with Lulu, leading to Johnny's arrest. Spinelli's condition worsens, and he is rushed to the hospital. Carly confides in Morgan about her potential pregnancy and the uncertainty surrounding the father.
</summary>

<summary>
Lulu reveals to Laura and Nikolas that she is having a girl, but Stavros had Nikolas shot when Lulu refused to sleep with him.  Luke is preparing to leave town to find the cure for his poisoning and doesn't want Tracy to come, but she convinces him to let her join him.  AJ reveals to Michael that he slept with Carly, and Elizabeth overheard Nikolas' confession about it.  Elizabeth is furious with Nikolas for not telling her that AJ didn't cheat on her.  Carly, Franco, and Ava convince Morgan that Carly is okay with him staying at the Quartermaine mansion, but Carly doesn't believe Franco is a changed man.  Shawn agrees to quit working for Sonny if Alexis will quit representing him.  Luke leaves town alone after all, leaving Tracy a note explaining that he can't risk her life.
</summary>

<summary>Patrick, a doctor, accidentally pricks himself with a needle while operating on an AIDS patient and has to undergo testing and treatment. Sonny continues therapy and argues with both his therapist and Carly about his mother's role in his abusive childhood. He eventually comes to terms with his anger towards his mother for not protecting him. Lucky learns that the bullet he fired at Manny missed, meaning Jason was the one who killed him. He feels betrayed by Elizabeth and like a fraud for receiving a medal. Sam and Jason get stuck in an elevator together. She confides in him about her insecurities and her upcoming GED test, and he helps her study. Nikolas and Emily spend time together caring for baby John, but Emily makes a mistake that could have harmed him, causing Nikolas to doubt her abilities as a mother. </summary>

<summary>
Sam finds out she is pregnant but is afraid she may have malaria and could pass it to the baby.  Julian is visited by Alexis in prison and asks her to lie for him to the Bar Association so she can keep her license to practice law.  He promises to help her in return.  Later, Julian escapes prison with the help of Holt.  Kevin and Laura get tested for malaria and find out they are in the clear.  Kristina and Aaron try to figure out their relationship after Kristina admits to having feelings for Parker.  Ava runs into Laura at the hospital and tells her that Nikolas died a hero.  Sam finds out her malaria test is negative but the doctor wants to see her, which she fears is bad news.
</summary>

<summary>
Lucky, high on pills, reveals to Nikolas and Emily that his marriage to Elizabeth is over because she caught him cheating with Maxie.  A heartbroken Elizabeth finds solace with Jason, and the two end up sleeping together.  Sam, feeling used by Ric, tells him she's going to tell Jason about their tryst, but Ric warns her that Jason will hate her for it.  Sonny confronts Ric about sleeping with Sam, realizing that Ric did it to get back at Jason, and urges Ric to focus on his family with Alexis. 
</summary>

<summary>It's Carly and Sonny's wedding day, but there's drama surrounding the event.  Morgan is struggling with a breakup and the possibility of being bipolar like his father.  Michael is conflicted about attending the wedding because Sonny killed his father, A.J.  Meanwhile, Sam and Anna team up to help Michael get ELQ back from Nikolas. </summary>

<summary>Sonny is shot and in critical condition on his wedding day.  Anna breaks up with Sloane after finding out he is working for Nikolas and tampered with the election.  Carly is oblivious to Sonny's condition and believes he is planning a surprise for their wedding. </summary>

<summary> Franco is a free man after the judge ruled that his brain tumor was responsible for his past crimes. Sonny is grieving the death of Connie and blames himself, but Morgan takes the blame, revealing that he was the one who asked Sonny to keep Kiki's paternity a secret. Britt gives birth to a baby boy with the help of Sabrina and Nikolas.  Sabrina brings the baby to the hospital when he has trouble breathing, and Silas assures Britt that her son is doing well.  Carly confronts Franco about his supposed feelings for her, but she doesn't believe him.  Ava is shocked to learn that Tracy is siding with Franco and kicking her out of the Quartermaine mansion and ELQ. </summary>

<summary>A deadly pathogen has infected Port Charles, and the only antidote is rigged with a bomb.  Jerry, who is dying from radiation sickness, is holding Alexis hostage and plans to escape with the antidote money.  Meanwhile, Tracy steals the only dose of the antidote to save her father, but Edward insists it be given to Emma.  In a final showdown, Sonny shoots and kills Jerry, saving Jax and the antidote. </summary>

<summary>Sonny is recovering from being shot, but his son Morgan is convinced Julian is responsible and sets out to kill him.  Morgan gets a gun from Milo and goes to Julian's, but he's not there.  Meanwhile, Alexis has rented a cabin for her and Julian to have some alone time, but she sends him there to hide out.  Morgan goes to Alexis's house looking for Julian and runs into TJ.  Carly and Michael are trying to find Morgan before he finds Julian.  Dillon is thrilled when Paul is able to get his movie back on track, but Tracy is concerned about Paul's methods.  Patrick asks Sam to marry him. </summary>

<summary>Sonny and "Kate's" wedding is interrupted by Olivia, and then by "Kate" herself, who reveals she's already married - to Johnny. Meanwhile, Kristina is kidnapped by Trey's father, Joe Jr., who plans to kill her and frame Sonny. Jason learns from Elizabeth that Sam's baby is alive and living with Téa. </summary>

<summary>Sonny is taking over the Zacchara organization and must marry Claudia to seal the deal, causing conflict with his family and friends. Jax buys the land surrounding Wyndemere to spite Carly, leading to a tense standoff with Nikolas. Jason faces danger from the Russian mob while trying to protect Elizabeth and her sons, who are hiding at a remote cabin. Claudia agrees to marry Sonny for her own gain and to strengthen Johnny's position within the organization, despite their mutual dislike. </summary>

<summary>Jason visits Franco's studio to find out what he knows about Claudia's murder. Sam is worried that Franco is setting a trap for Jason. Meanwhile, Carly wants to tell the police the truth about Claudia's death but Sonny convinces her not to.  Olivia and Johnny are having relationship problems because Olivia is in love with Sonny.  Nikolas accidentally runs over Rebecca with his car and Ethan thinks he did it on purpose. </summary>

<summary>
Franco confessed to Kevin that he killed his mother, Heather, and Kevin agreed to be Franco's therapist. Spinelli decided to move to Portland with his girlfriend and daughter, despite Maxie's initial reservations. 
</summary>

<summary>Carly is unable to go home for Christmas as she had hoped, and Sonny is upset that Courtney will be spending Christmas with Nikolas. Meanwhile, Alexis is appointed to defend Manny Ruiz, who claims he is a changed man after his surgery. </summary>

<summary>
Gus discovers he has a 16-year-old son, Rafe, from a previous relationship with Natalia. Natalia reveals she kept Rafe a secret because she was scared and didn't want to ruin Gus's life with Harley. Meanwhile, Rick and Mel navigate co-parenting Leah while dealing with Alan's interference and the impending arrival of Rick and Beth's baby. Beth feels suffocated by Alan's overprotectiveness and plans a trip to Paris to see Mindy. Rafe, struggling with the revelation of his father's identity, gets into trouble and is taken to a holding cell. Harley comforts Daisy, who is worried about both Rafe and Gus. Natalia, desperate to see Rafe, learns he's been transferred to a police station. The episode ends with tensions rising as Gus confronts Remy about revealing his secret, and Rafe vehemently denies Gus's claim of being his father. 
</summary>

<summary>Rick is heartbroken over his break-up with Beth and cancels the annual Bauer barbecue.  Cassie and Josh offer to host the event at their farm instead.  Bill and Ava attend the barbecue, pretending to be a happy couple despite the fact that Bill knows the baby is not his.  Lizzie reveals the truth about Ava's baby to Remy.  Alan suffers a mysterious fall and suddenly feels better than ever.  Beth realizes that she still loves Rick and regrets breaking up with him.  Mallet delivers an impromptu speech about the meaning of Independence Day.  The episode ends with the residents of Springfield celebrating the Fourth of July together. </summary>

<summary>This episode of "Guiding Light" centers around the complex relationships between the characters. Reva returns to her old job at the bar owned by Nate, the man who may have killed her sister-in-law and abused her son, while Tammy and Sandy's relationship falls apart due to Jonathan's interference. </summary>

<summary> Alan confesses to shooting Phillip but claims it was self-defense. However, Alexandra reveals she has incriminating evidence: gloves with powder burns and Phillip's blood. Alan is arrested for Phillip's murder. Meanwhile, Edmund learns Dinah lost their baby and proposes they try again, but she reveals the miscarriage was weeks ago. Cassie arrives as Dinah tries to convince Edmund to start a family with her. Elsewhere, Tammy tries to reconcile with Sandy, who is now interested in April. Jonathan warns April to stay away from Tammy, hinting at his violent nature. Dinah confides in Jonathan about losing the baby and her feelings for Edmund. He advises her to protect herself by hurting others before they hurt her. </summary>

<summary>Shayne is dealing with newfound fame after being drafted by a baseball team, while Marina grapples with her lingering feelings for Ben, who believes he's identified his attacker as Mitch Hendon.  Meanwhile, Eden maintains her innocence as Gus suspects her involvement in the murders, leading Tony to offer his support. As Gus closes in on Mitch, Cassie discovers Mitch's presence at the Beacon, unaware of the danger he poses.  </summary>

<summary> Cyrus and Alexandra host a fundraiser for a local hospital. Cyrus is secretly working with Griggs to steal the donations. Marina is suspicious of Cyrus and tries to figure out his plan. Meanwhile, Dinah is torn between her feelings for Mallet and Matt. Matt is upset that Vanessa is at the fundraiser with Billy. Harley confronts Cyrus about his relationship with Marina. At the end of the night, Marina discovers Cyrus' plan and confronts him. </summary>

<summary>Shayne is struggling with the aftereffects of his injury and refuses help from Josh, pushing him away. Reva worries about Shayne but Jeffrey assures her that he needs to figure things out on his own.  Meanwhile, Beth contemplates a romantic getaway with Coop despite their age difference and her complicated relationship with Alan.  Lizzie prepares to leave for China to save the Macau deal, urged by Bill to focus on their future. Remy grapples with his feelings for Ava while Mel encourages him to give his marriage with Christina a chance. Buzz warns Coop about the dangers of his involvement with Beth, highlighting the potential consequences of their affair. </summary>

<summary>This episode of "One Life to Live" features multiple storylines centered around love, betrayal, and forgiveness.  Asa and Rae's contentious divorce takes center stage, while Blair forgives Todd's past transgressions, and Roxy grapples with Max's sincerity. </summary>

<summary> Chloe's christening brings together family and friends, but secrets and suspicions cast a shadow over the joyous occasion.  Natalie and Jared agree to be Chloe's godparents, concealing their knowledge of the baby's true parentage – Starr and Cole's deceased daughter, Hope.  Cole becomes suspicious about Hope's death, learning that it wasn't due to Rh incompatibility as previously believed.  Meanwhile, Jessica grapples with her feelings for Brody and the pain of Nash's absence.  John and Blair's marriage is revealed, a strategic move to protect Blair's children from Todd, who remains determined to gain custody.  However, the investigation into Blair's stabbing takes a shocking turn when the murder weapon is found with John's fingerprint on it.  Markko's loyalty is tested when Cole asks him to help fake a drug test, while Langston worries about the consequences of their actions.  As the episode ends, the truth about Hope's death and John's innocence hang in the balance, promising more drama to come. </summary>

<summary>
Todd is arrested for pushing Marty down the stairs, but he claims he is innocent. Dani struggles with her feelings for Todd, unsure if she can forgive him for his past actions. Meanwhile, Rex receives a promising lead on the necklace and plans to travel to Santa Fe. Langston breaks up with Markko, revealing she is in love with Ford, his T.A.  Blair learns that Téa is dying and confronts her about her unwavering support for Todd. Téa confesses that she needs to ensure Dani has Todd in her life before she's gone. 
</summary>

<summary>Viki suffers a coronary but recovers with her family's support. John believes Dr. Long is involved in illegal organ harvesting but lacks evidence. Marcie, determined to help Michael, sneaks into Dr. Long's office to find proof. Meanwhile, Paul's behavior worries David, who suspects Paul is harming Kelly. John seeks solace in Nora's company, while Lindsay tries to reconnect with Jen. As the night unfolds, Michael discovers Marcie is missing and fears the worst. Paul, caught in a compromising situation with an unconscious Kelly, tries to explain his actions to a suspicious David. </summary>

<summary>John suspects Miles is involved in Todd's disappearance and plays him a tape found at Todd's last known whereabouts.  Marty is attacked but fights back against her assailants.  Jessica tells Antonio she's in love with Nash, leaving Antonio feeling betrayed and angry at both Jessica and Cristian.  Viki feels helpless to save Jessica but vows to find a way.  Clint finds comfort and support from Dorian.  Nash reassures Jessica that she will survive and they will be together.  John remains suspicious of Miles after a series of coincidences.</summary>

<summary>Dorian is upset because Viki invited David to stay at Llanfair. Dorian believes Viki is trying to make her jealous, and she confronts them both. Meanwhile, Sarah is trying to help Blair find Todd, who has been kidnapped by Hunter. Hunter takes Todd to Miles' apartment and demands payment. Miles is shocked to see Todd's unconscious body and pays Hunter. John tries to convince Marty to leave Miles, but she refuses because she is afraid of what he will do to Cole. Blair returns to Llanview, leaving Rex and Cristian in Chicago to continue searching for Todd. </summary>

<summary>
The episode centers around the aftermath of Natalie's kidnapping. Viki confronts Marcie, blaming her book for inspiring the killer. Rex grapples with guilt, believing his actions led to Natalie's abduction.  Meanwhile, Jessica sends a note with Todd, asking Antonio for space.  Nora anxiously awaits the results of her HIV test due to Colson's actions.  John and Marcie work together to decipher the killer's motives, fearing for Natalie's life.  Bo juggles the search for Natalie with supporting Nora.  Tess, in a fit of anger, steals a car from a valet stand after a confrontation with a rude man.  Antonio struggles with Jessica's need for space, while Viki worries about both her daughters.  The episode ends with Nora receiving a negative HIV test result but knowing more tests are needed. 
</summary>

<summary> The episode revolves around the hunt for the Killing Club Killer, Hayes Barber, who has kidnapped Marcie and Rex.  John McBain desperately tries to get information from a wounded Nick, who was forced to participate in the killings. Meanwhile, Blair and Starr try to rebuild their relationship after the trauma caused by Margaret Cochran. </summary>

<summary>
Al's health deteriorates, and he needs a liver transplant. Antonio and Keri fight for custody of their daughter, Jamie, in court.  Despite R.J.'s attempts to prevent it, the judge grants joint custody to Antonio and Keri.  Asa pressures Cristian to dig up dirt on Dawes, but Cristian is hesitant to get involved.  Meanwhile, Blair is torn between Walker and Kevin, while Kelly fends off David's advances.  David claims to be in love with Dorian, who is secretly using him to manipulate Kelly.  Marcie dedicates a song to Al on his radio show, hoping for his recovery.  R.J. is furious with Evangeline for offering Antonio a job and fears her testimony will hurt their case.  Todd surprises Blair by playing the piano and expressing his feelings for her.  The episode ends with Al's dire health situation and the escalating conflict between the Buchanans and Dawes. 
</summary>

<summary>
Rex accidentally ends up in the women's steam room with Kelly and confides in her about his relationship troubles with Gigi. Gigi, meanwhile, is in Paris with Adriana and Layla, and gets into a physical altercation with Adriana after she makes snide remarks about her relationship with Rex.  Cole prepares to leave for prison and breaks up with Starr, urging her to move on with her life. John is upset with Natalie for not telling him about her amniocentesis, but they eventually reconcile.  Ford and James's abusive father, Eddie, shows up unexpectedly and announces he will be staying with them. Inez tries to intervene, but Ford insists they can handle the situation themselves. Cole says goodbye to Starr and their daughter, Hope, before leaving for prison with John.  Layla decides to go to Milan for work, leaving Cristian behind in Paris.  Markko prepares to leave Llanview and says goodbye to Langston.  Eddie makes disparaging remarks about Inez and Nate, leading to a confrontation. Inez decides to take Ford and James back with her, despite their protests. 
</summary>

<summary> Rebecca, fueled by her vendetta against Theresa, manipulates Ethan into evicting the Lopez-Fitzgerald family from their home by threatening his relationship with Gwen. Meanwhile, Whitney, feeling lost and hurt by her past experiences, considers returning to singing, much to her mother Eve's dismay. Liz, eager to see Eve suffer, offers Whitney a singing job at the Blue Note, hoping to create a rift between mother and daughter.  Miguel, facing unemployment due to Rebecca's schemes, finds solace and support in Kay, who steps up to help him care for their daughter, Maria. Theresa, witnessing Rebecca's abuse towards little Ethan through a hidden camera, tries to report it to Child Protective Services, but her claims are dismissed.  Ethan, torn between his loyalty to Theresa and his love for Gwen, reluctantly agrees to evict the Lopez-Fitzgeralds, knowing it will devastate them.  Rebecca relishes in her victory, eager to witness Theresa's downfall as she loses her home.  As the Lopez-Fitzgerald family struggles to cope with their financial burdens and the looming threat of eviction, Rebecca's web of manipulation tightens, promising further turmoil and heartbreak. </summary>

<summary>This dramatic episode revolves around the aftermath of a fire at the Crane estate, suspected to be arson. While Sheridan recovers in the hospital, tensions rise as various characters grapple with love, betrayal, and revenge. </summary>

<summary>
T.C. is furious with Eve, blaming her for Whitney giving their grandson up for adoption. Both Eve and Julian, and T.C. and Liz, decide to try and adopt the baby. Sheridan insists on a DNA test for Marty, convinced he is her son, but Beth refuses, making Luis suspicious. Ethan, Fox, and Theresa are on the run from Alden's guards. Gwen nearly attacks Theresa but is stopped by Katherine.  Tabitha delights in the chaos, predicting a difficult outcome for everyone involved. Luis, fed up with Beth's refusal, insists on the DNA test for Marty. Ethan grapples with the decision of choosing between Theresa and Gwen.  Gwen nearly attacks Theresa again but is stopped by Katherine.
</summary>

<summary> Kay goes into premature labor after an argument with Miguel, causing her to worry about their relationship. Tabitha's demonic baby is born and Charity witnesses it, but Miguel doesn't believe her.  Julian takes the blame for the fire at Liz's club, which was actually caused by his carelessness with gasoline. Luis doesn't believe Sheridan is in Paris and decides to continue searching for her, much to Beth's dismay.  Sheridan, trapped by Beth, believes someone is trying to kill her. Eve reveals to T.C. that she encouraged Whitney to be with Chad to protect her, but doesn't explain further. </summary>

<summary>
Jessica's family and friends stage an intervention to convince her to leave her abusive husband, Spike. Spike threatens to reveal secrets about Jessica if she testifies against him. Meanwhile, Kay grapples with her feelings for both Fox and Miguel, while Endora, a mischievous witch, meddles in their love lives. Sheridan struggles with her lingering feelings for Luis, despite being married to Chris. Fancy and Chris navigate their own relationship insecurities stemming from Luis and Sheridan's past. Theresa and Jared's romantic getaway is interrupted by the suspicious noises coming from Gwen and Ethan's room, leading to a comical search for the source.
</summary>

<summary> Kay is torn between marrying Fox, who has just been diagnosed with a terminal illness, and Miguel, the father of her child. Fox, unaware of Kay's dilemma, believes his illness will make Kay stay with him. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa try to bribe J.T. for information about Ethan, with Gwen ultimately offering the highest amount.  Elsewhere, Luis, Sheridan, and Paloma try to rescue Fancy from a cave, suspecting Chris of foul play.  As Luis tries to save Fancy, the rope slips, leaving her fate uncertain. Ethan wakes up to find Rebecca in bed with him, mistaking her for Gwen. Finally, Theresa and J.T. head off to tell Ethan the truth about Gwen's deception. </summary>

<summary>
Kevin, struggling with addiction, seeks help from Karen but refuses treatment, wanting the ingredients of Joshua's drug. Ian, battling his bloodlust, gets more blood from Chris, fearing he might harm Lucy. Elizabeth seeks Lucy's help to find Alison, who is held captive by Joshua. Joshua reveals his past friendship with Alison's father and his desire for power. Rafe confronts Jamal, who is now a vampire, about Alison's whereabouts. Lucy, despite losing her slayer powers, decides to use her intuition to find Alison. 
</summary>

<summary>Sharon asks Victor to help Adam, who is in jail for Skye's murder, but Victor refuses. Daniel is found unconscious and suffering from hypothermia after going to look for Daisy. Daisy is caught on camera at an ATM in Canada. Cane gets fired after Blake fails to deliver the report. Colin wants to see his grandchildren, but Lily is skeptical. Phyllis blames herself for what happened to Daniel. Nick is planning to file for full custody of Faith. Tucker wants to start planning a wedding with Ashley. </summary>

<summary>
Victor is confident that the forensic accounting of Newman Enterprises will come back clean, and it does. However, Vance, the lawyer representing Victoria and Abby in their lawsuit against Victor, argues that Victor's plan to sell a subsidiary in Dubai is a calculated move to devalue the company and cheat his daughters out of their inheritance. The judge sides with Vance and freezes a third of Newman's assets. Meanwhile, Jack travels to Hawaii and finds the burned-out shack where Skye was living. He also finds a bottle of her rare perfume, which he believes is proof that she was there. He tries to convince the police, but they are not interested.  Sharon's hopes are raised, but the D.A. refuses to believe her story and accuses her of planting the perfume bottle.  Ronan reveals to Nina that he has a fatal illness and refuses her offer to donate part of her liver to him. However, Nina is determined to help her son and tells him that she will not let him die. Heather discovers that the gun used to shoot Chance was loaded with blanks, leading her and Paul to believe that Ronan is not who he seems.
</summary>

<summary>Lily and Tyler get stuck in an elevator, where Lily helps Tyler through a claustrophobic episode.  Chelsea considers Cane's offer to help launch her fashion career while her mother, Anita, encourages her to find a lover.  Jamie accuses Fenmore of pushing him off the roof while Summer and Paul watch on in disbelief. </summary>

<summary>
Nick buys Jabot's debt with the intention of foreclosing on the company, a move that angers Victor, who promised the Abbotts he wouldn't take over. Jack calls an emergency shareholder meeting to deal with the crisis and proposes selling a majority stake in Jabot to Chancellor Industries. Meanwhile, Drucilla anxiously awaits the results of a paternity test while dealing with Phyllis's suspicions and interference. Malcolm grapples with the potential implications of the test results on his relationship with Drucilla and Lily.  Victor thwarts Nick's plan by buying Jabot's debt himself, causing a rift between father and son.  Despite Nikki's doubts about Victor's involvement, Jack pushes forward with his plan to sell Jabot to Chancellor. Lily feels increasingly isolated as she senses secrets and tension within her family.  The episode ends with Drucilla and Malcolm anxiously awaiting the paternity test results. 
</summary>

<summary>Gloria and Jeff celebrate having the Abbott mansion all to themselves, but Gloria's sons refuse to ever step foot in the house again.  Meanwhile, Jack and Sharon decide to sell their house and start fresh after losing the Abbott mansion to Gloria and Jeff.  Elsewhere, Victor takes a business trip to Los Angeles and visits an art exhibit with Sabrina, where he is inspired to create a legacy for himself. </summary>

<summary>
Adam's body was found and the police began investigating his murder. The police searched the Newman ranch and questioned Victor, Nick, and Ashley. They also questioned Jack, Ashley, and Patty at the Abbott mansion.  Jack's monogrammed handkerchief was found in Adam's mouth.  Phyllis asked Sharon to help her get rid of Nick's bloody jacket.  Ryder met Abby at their "secret meeting place" and told her he was glad he ran into her. Lauren demanded that Sheila show herself. Victor told Owen that he broke his watch while backslapping Adam and that the blood on it was Adam's.
</summary>

<summary>This dramatic episode centers around the fallout of Victor's scheme to break up Billy and Victoria, with Chelsea facing the consequences and Adam caught in the crossfire. Meanwhile, Jack prepares to marry Genevieve for business purposes, despite Nikki's pleas and the shadow of Victor's manipulations. Other storylines include the custody battle over Lucy, Devon and Tucker's musical collaboration, and Avery grappling with her father's legacy. </summary>

<summary>
Victor purchased Beauty of Nature from Genevieve, but worries their deal will be investigated by the SEC.  Lauren is arrested for pulling a gun on Daisy at Fenmore's, and Michael is forced to deal with the situation instead of retrieving Fenmore with Lauren.  Devon celebrates his successful surgery and burgeoning music career with friends and family.  Phyllis struggles to cope with losing custody of Lucy, and Nick asks Victor to pull strings with the judge, but Victor claims he can't help.  Tucker agrees to help Genevieve with her legal troubles in exchange for a percentage of the sale of Beauty of Nature. 
</summary>

<summary>
Phyllis and Nick celebrate their first anniversary with a treasure hunt organized by Nick. Jack and Sharon reflect on their past relationships and find solace in each other. Lily struggles to cope with the loss of her baby and throws herself into work, pushing Cane away. Gloria discovers Jeffrey is staying at Jill's and suspects foul play, while Jill and Kay plot to use Jeffrey to get information about Gloria. Victor favors Adam over Victoria in a business decision, causing tension between the siblings. Amber seeks relationship advice from Kay, who encourages her to embrace love. Daniel supports Amber but is wary of her attempts to keep him close.  Nick gives Phyllis a GPS tracker as a promise to always find his way back to her.
</summary>

<summary>Phyllis tells Daniel that she and Nick are getting married and that she's pregnant. Daniel tells Phyllis that he and Daisy are getting married. Ricky tries to get sympathy from Paul by pretending that his mom sent him a mean birthday card, but Paul sees through his lie.  Avery agrees to represent Lauren, who has been charged with felony assault with intent to do bodily harm. </summary>

<summary>Cassie's fever breaks and she remembers that she was driving the car.  John tells Kevin that he will never forgive him or Gloria.  Michael gives Lauren an original Eric Forrester dress and takes her out for a night on the town. </summary>

<summary>
Tensions rise as Nick discovers Summer threw a party with alcohol at Phyllis's penthouse, leading to a fight with Fenmore and Kyle coming to her rescue.  Nick's overprotectiveness and disapproval of Kyle cause further conflict with Summer and Phyllis.  Meanwhile, Sharon struggles with her feelings for Adam and the anniversary of Cassie's death, seeking guidance from Dr. Watkins.  Lauren and Michael's marriage remains strained due to her affair with Carmine, who faces pressure from Paul to leave Lauren alone.  Fenmore grapples with his feelings for Summer and witnesses his parents' marital problems.  Kyle develops feelings for Summer, causing friction with Nick and intrigue from Jack. 
</summary>

<summary>Chloe is struggling to cope with Delia's death and pushes Kevin away, leading him to realize she needs more help than he can provide. Meanwhile, Ian is cleared of extortion charges, infuriating Nikki and Dylan, and leading Victor to take matters into his own hands. </summary>

<summary>
Nick is haunted by the death of his daughter, Cassie, and blames himself for letting her go out the night of the accident. He believes that if he had kept her home, everything would be different. Cassie's spirit appears to Nick and takes him on a journey to show him how things might have been if he had made different choices.  Nick sees that even if he had made different decisions, there's no guarantee that life would be perfect. Cassie helps Nick to see that he needs to stop blaming himself for everything and start living his life again. She reminds him that he has a wife and son who love him and need him.  Nick realizes that Cassie is right and decides to move back home to be with his family. He promises Cassie that he will try to move on with his life and not give up. Cassie assures Nick that she will always be with him.
</summary>

<summary>Daisy and Phyllis appear in court to try and win parental rights over Lucy.  Diane tells Victor she is pregnant and then has complications, leading to Victor going with her to the hospital.  As Newman Enterprises goes public, Adam attempts to sabotage the IPO by leaking information about Victor's health.  The episode ends with a cliffhanger about Victor's fate and the judge's decision regarding Lucy. </summary>

<summary> Adam is suing Nick for full custody of Christian after Victoria gave him a large sum of money to leave Genoa City. Kevin kidnapped Phyllis to trade for Chloe, who is being held captive by Adam, but Adam wants Kevin to stay in town and help him with something. Riza shows up at Adam's, intrigued by his sudden interest in him. </summary>

<summary>Kevin is moving to Portland with Bella for a fresh start after Chloe's death, despite his family's concerns. Nikki returns from a spa trip, claiming to be ready for the concert, but Nick is worried about her health after Tessa reveals Nikki's MS flare-up.  Victor is excited about the concert and hopes it will bring the family back together, while Nick believes it's just another way for Victor to control Nikki.  Kevin says goodbye to Michael and runs into Chelsea, who apologizes for her behavior at Chloe's funeral. </summary>

<summary>
Sharon is upset because Nick has been ignoring her and went to see Phyllis first after returning to town. Nick tells Phyllis that he loves her and the baby but has decided to stay with his wife and son. Colleen is worried about the threats she has been receiving and tells her dad, Brad, about them. Brad lies to Colleen, telling her that JT and Paul were hired by Victor to do a background check on him when he and Victoria were engaged. JT travels to Cleveland and interviews the neighbor who found the Kaplan family after they were murdered. The neighbor identifies Brad as George Kaplan, the son who murdered his family, in a photo. 
</summary>

<summary>Phyllis is fired by Billy from Restless Style due to her arrest, and he plans to exploit her story for the magazine and his new TV series.  Victoria is torn between job offers from Jack at Beauty of Nature, Ashley at Jabot, and Victor at Newman Enterprises.  Jack consolidates his power at Jabot, while Ashley threatens to fight him.  Adam and Chelsea return from their elopement to a luxurious new home, while Anita returns to Genoa City, much to Victoria's dismay.  Nick punches Billy for his treatment of Phyllis, who is advised by Avery and Nick to stay out of the media.  Gloria discovers Anita's claim of being married to Jeff and vows to uncover the truth.  The episode ends with a cliffhanger involving Cane and Genevieve. </summary>

<summary>
Devon and Hilary are getting married in the hospital because Hilary is seriously ill. Hilary knows her prognosis is grim but wants to enjoy her wedding day. Devon is putting on a brave face but is heartbroken. Lily, who accidentally caused the accident that injured Hilary, feels guilty and almost doesn't attend the wedding. Mariah, Hilary's co-host, is planning to leave town with Tessa to find Tessa's sister. Before the ceremony, Hilary has a heartfelt conversation with Neil, her ex-husband, and they agree to be friends. During the ceremony, Hilary becomes weak but insists on finishing her vows. Devon and Hilary are pronounced husband and wife. 
</summary>

<summary>
John Abbott is rushed to the hospital after experiencing blurred vision and a headache. Doctors diagnose him with a minor stroke but assure his family he will be fine. John's son, Jack, is skeptical of his stepfather's condition and the hospital's care. Meanwhile, Lily struggles to cope with the revelation of Daniel's past betrayal and the strained relationship between her parents. Dru and Neil's constant arguing over Lily's situation and their past grievances comes to a head, with Neil ultimately declaring he is done with their marriage. As John's children and Katherine comfort Gloria, Jack receives troubling news about his father's health. A code blue is announced, leaving John's fate uncertain. 
</summary>

<summary>
Victor Newman has died and left his company to his son, Adam. Adam has fired Neil and Victoria and hired Brad to be the new CEO.  Nikki is missing in Mexico and everyone is worried about her. Jack angered Nick by making a rude comment about Victor and by hacking into his computer.  Jill is furious with Brad for the article about her in Restless Style and is threatening to sue him.  Cane and Chloe are trying to work through their issues.  Heather is moving in with Adam at the ranch.
</summary>

<summary>The episode revolves around Katherine Chancellor's friends and family gathering a year after her death to fulfill her final wishes. Katherine left instructions for everyone to write letters expressing their feelings and then burn them, symbolically sending their messages to her. The episode explores various characters' emotional states and relationships, including Neil grappling with his blindness, Devon's lingering feelings for Hilary, and Jill's realization that her journey with Colin is more important than finding the treasure she believed was hidden in Katherine's music box. Meanwhile, Nikki struggles with her sobriety, and Victor remains oblivious to her relapse. In a parallel storyline, Billy helps Victoria attend their son's preschool orientation despite her recent health scare. The episode concludes with Jill deciding to let go of the music box, realizing that Katherine's true gift was the journey they shared.  As the episode ends, Victor's plan to awaken Phyllis from her coma is set in motion. </summary>

<summary>This episode revolves around the aftermath of River's arrest and the impact it has on his daughter, Eden. Meanwhile, Jill celebrates the dismissal of the SEC investigation, and Cane cares for a pregnant Chloe while dealing with Jill's plans for Chancellor Industries. </summary>

<summary>Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters foundation and blames Billy for his marriage falling apart.  Jack and Phyllis fight and he kicks her out of the house, but she falls and is unconscious.  Billy is struggling with his guilt and Neil encourages him to work the 12 steps.  Victoria tells Travis she wants him to move in and give their relationship a real chance.  Ashley is frustrated with both Jack and Billy and thinks they should both stay away from Phyllis. </summary>

<summary> Damon is in critical condition in the hospital after being stabbed. His son, Elias, who died as a child, appears to him and they share a heartfelt reunion. Ashley confesses her feelings to Victor, but he rejects her, reaffirming his love for Nikki. Ashley and Brad decide to separate, leaving Ashley heartbroken and worried about their daughter Abby.  Kevin finds Lily distraught over her encounter with Alex and comforts her, assuring her that Alex will never hurt her again.  Nick offers to pay Sharon's salary so she can work at Jabot, and Jack agrees to see what he can do. Michael prepares to fight Kevin, who is angry about Michael's relationship with Lauren. </summary>

<summary>
Chance receives a commendation for his bravery, and Chloe feels jealous of Heather. Billy sleeps with Kelly after a fight with Mac, and Mac breaks up with him. Daniel, Phyllis, and Amber worry about Daniel's future as his grand jury hearing approaches. Michael tries to get information from Heather but fails. Kevin tries to convince Daniel and Jana that Ryder will help Daniel. Daisy reveals to Daniel that Ryder sent a rat to his wedding. Kay throws a party for Chance, and Jill accuses Chloe of wanting to get back together with Billy. Chloe tells Billy that she doesn't love him anymore.
</summary>

<summary> The episode revolves around various Christmas-themed storylines. Victoria suspects she might be pregnant, causing tension with Chloe who is dealing with a child services complaint after a Christmas photo shoot. Meanwhile, Cane finds himself in a difficult position as Blake's fabricated past is investigated, and Daisy's pregnancy causes conflict between Phyllis, Daniel, and Kevin. </summary>
<summary>Devon and Hilary reconcile after Devon agrees to make Hilary the executive producer of GC Buzz.  Jack kicks Billy out of the Abbott family Christmas Eve celebration. </summary>

<summary>
Faith runs away from home because she is upset that her parents are splitting up, but is later found safe and sound. Victoria decides to give her daughter the last name Abbott-Newman, which upsets Billy. Constance reveals to Adam that his father committed suicide after Victor Newman took over his company.
</summary>

<summary>
Cane brought his baby Sam home from the hospital and had a welcome home party. Jill told Cane that she sold Chancellor to Jabot and that he would keep his job. Billy found out that Jill sold Chancellor and told her that Jack is no longer the CEO. Ashley called a board meeting and added an amendment that the CEO has to work from the Jabot office. Mattie, Charlie, and Reed went to a party where Reed was drinking. Mattie called the police on Reed for drinking and driving. Jack told Ashley that he will be returning to work at Jabot. Victoria got a call from the police saying that Reed was arrested. 
</summary>
